 [1] "The Moto G4 Play and Moto E3 Power are currently the best offerings by the Lenovo owned Motorola. If you're not really a fan of Chinese deviceslike Redmi, Coolpad, Meizu or OnePlus, Motorola devices have really proven themselves to be quite long lasting companions.Now, within the budget segment of 10K, we've these 2 phones and without much delay I would like to review how both these phones fair against each other.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Build Quality:->-----------------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play look quite similar to each other. Both feature a plastic body with a sort of textured finish. But the E3 Power houses a separate speaker grill at the bottom bezels while the G4 Play has a mono grill at the top for the earpiece and speaker. The sound output is better on E3 Power due to the extra grill.The back of E3 Power lacks a textured finish while the G4 Play has a texture design on back, making it easy to hold in hand.Screen & Display:->------------------------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play feature a 5\" inch 720 x 1280 pixels 294 ppi pixel density display. It's fairly bright and offers great contrast thanks to the low black levels. Sunlight legibility is also good.Both the phones have Corning Gorilla Glass 3 Protection and Nano Coating which makes them splash proof or accidental water spillings.While the Moto G4 Play has Moto Display and One Handed Mode, the E3 Power doesn't have them.Performance:->-----------------------The E3 Power runs on a MediaTek 6735P QuadCore CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1GHz and a Mali-T720 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 1.1GB to be free. Switching between apps and multi-tasking is fluid. The phone has noticeable lags on heavy usage. The device performs poorly on heavy gaming, although midrange games like Subway Surfers run well without any issues. No heating issues as well.The G4 Play runs on a Snapdragon 410 Quad Core CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1.2GHz and a Adreno 306 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 900 MB to be free. Ram management seems poor on G4 Play as compared to E3 Power as the usage seems to be more. But surprisingly the device fares better to E3 Power in terms of  multi-tasking and Gaming due to a powerful CPU. Asphalt 8 runs smoothly without any issue. The device heats upto 38.C to 40.C which isn't always an issue.Storage:->---------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play come with 16GB of Internal Storage. You get upto 11GB free on E3 Power while around 10.5GB on the G4 Play. Both the phones support USB OTG.Expandable Storage:E3 Power: 32GB via MicroSD CardG4 Play: 128GB via MicroSD CardCamera:->----------------Both the E3 Power and G4 Play house a 8MP Rear and 5MP Front facing Camera. The performance is above average in daylight and proper lighting conditions. The Camera performs average in night and low light. The flash is really helpful in low light. The device runs Moto's Stock Camera app with a Shutter button. You can use the exposure mode, Panoroma, HDR or Video Modes. While the E3 Power can only record 720p videos, G4 Play can record upto 1080p videos. The Camera focusing on E3 Power is better than that of G4 Play, so is the post image processing but the shutter speed is better in G4 Play.The Selfie Camera will really delight you. You can always use a 3rd Party filter app on the both these devices to take some neat selfies.Battery:->---------------While the E3 Power comes with a 3600maH battery, the G4 Play comes with a 2800maH battery. The battery on E3 Power is nothing short to incredible and easily lasts for a day with moderate usage. and last over 1.5 days but with heavy usage lasts only upto 9 to 10 hours.. You can get screen on-time of 8 to 9 hours easily. The rapid charger bundled with the phone takes 3.5 hours to 4 hours to fully charge the device.The G4 Play lasts upto a day with moderate usage but with heavy usage lasts only upto 7 to 8 hours. The G4 Play also comes with the rapid charger and the charging takes around 3 hours.Both the phones feature a removable battery.4G Network & Jio:->-------------------------------Both Moto E3 Power and G4 Play support VoLTE (Band 40) and can be used with a Reliance Jio Sim Welcome Offer. Yes, you can dial numbers from Stock Dialer without connecting to Mobile Data. Bear in mind that the phones reach upto a temperature of 40.C when continuously on 4G.Battery Life on 4G:->-------------------------------With continuous 4G usage, the E3 Power can last for 6 to 7 hours while the G4 Play lasts upto 5 hours.Software & OS:->--------------------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play run of Stock Android version of Android 6.0 Marshmallow with Minor Tweaks by Motorola. Although the E3 Power is a month old, it won't get the Android Nougat 7.0 update which is a huge disappointment for budget users, while the G4 Play with 14 other devices will get Android 7.0 Nougat Update.Conclusion->--------------------The E3 Power proves to be the obvious choice if you want a device that performs better on battery life as well as the Camera. The E3 Power is available every Monday via Flash sales on Flipkart for Rs 7999.The G4 Play although has a smaller battery is a better performer with the powerful CPU and higher capacity for storage via MicroSD Card. The G4 Play will also get the Nougat Update.If you're not into heavy usage and Android Updates, the E3 Power should be your choice."  [2] "The review is post 3 months of usage, we shall discuss point wise(sorry if I bore you) Please take time and read, THIS IS IMPORTANT1. Works with any LTE network(Vodafone, Idea, Airtel, IMPORTANTLY -JIO) with 4G speeds (and slower speeds as well). Will probably work with any carrier that allows you to BYOD (bring your own device). And will probably work on networks around the world with the correct SIM card and plan, but may not work on all frequency bands in some locations.2. Good battery life, probably very good. I use this as my 2nd phone but other reviewers give it good marks as well.3. No non-Google bloatware (unless you buy the version with lock-screen ads - this one here is NOT that!)4. Sounds good and works very well. Latest version of Android on this phone is Marshmallow (6.0.x). Having worked with the very latest version (Nougat) on another phone, and then downgrading it to Marshmallow, I recommend sticking with Marshmallow for the time being.5. Easy to get cases and screen protectors for this, and quite inexpensively.6. 16GB memory is a bit lean, but I recommend installing a 32GB or 64GB Class-10 name-brand Micro SD card (yes it takes one!) and allowing the phone to \"adopt\" it. Read more about this online.7. Easily removable / interchangeable battery.8. According to reviewers, camera is decent at best; that said, it's certainly not \"bad.\" I have installed \"Camera MX\" from Appic Labs - available in the Play Store. To me it's an improvement over the default camera app.9. While it's not the fastest phone, performance-wise, it performs well, especially for the price.Note: This phone takes a Micro SIM - many modern phones take a Nano SIM, which means you will need to change SIM cards if coming from an iPhone 5, 6, 7 (for example) or getting a SIM adapter (be careful using these, but they can be made to work well, and once installed and working, you are fine).Please hit helpful YES if you like my detailed review. It will help me write more and more for helping our Amazon community"  [3] "First of all, I am picky about phones, tablets...all electronics. Being a techie type, I researched many phones before I decided to purchase this G4 Play...And after using this phone every day, all day long, I have discovered that this was the best choice of a phone for me.Well, I have written my review as if I were you reading reviews trying to decide to buy this phone or not...PROS:+ MICRO SIM CARD -- While Nano Sims are gradually being the standard SIM size and are the size for newer phones, I still like this size.Note to Nano SIM users: You can install a Nano SIM in this phone IF you carefully place it into an adapter or just go to your phone store and they can move your info from your Nano Card to a new Micro SIM card. Be sure you have a new Micro SIM with you in case they do not have one. Amazon sells Micro Sims.+ Size, Weight, and Comfort of the Phone...This 5 inch screen, weight of the phone, comfort while holding this phone are some major reasons why I bought this phone. I had a huge 5.5 Samsung J7 (2015). It was too big for my small hands and very uncomfortable to hold. And because the G4 Play is a lighter weight phone and not bulky, I am love this!This phone fits my hand perfectly and comfortable to hold.+ Memory/Storage has 16GB Internal however after OS and factory apps 10.6 GB left. External card slot can handle up to 256GB.There is no bloatware...pure Android experience...About twenty one essential factory Installed apps including Phone and Help. Most of the apps are Android / Google Apps. Only about six Motorola apps which includes the Camera, File Manager, FM Radio, Phone, Settings and Calc. Motorola allows Android and Google to supply just the Apps you need, however, later on you can install Apps you like as there is plenty of room left. Below is a list of Google / Android Apps pre-installed on this phone:* Calendar (Google Calendar)* Clock (Google Clock)* Contacts (Google)* Chrome Internet Browser* FM Radio App (Moto installed this on this phone, no Internet needed...real FM Radio)* Google App* Google Maps* Google Music* Hangouts (Google)* Messenger (Google Messenger for Texts and MMS (Picture or Video Messages).* Photos (It is a Photo Gallery by Google).* Play Movies/Play Music* Playstore* Settings (Android Settings)Because I just installed Apps I wanted like Facebook, Twitter, PrinterShare and other large Apps, I still have 8.25 GB Internal Storage now left if I want to add more apps later on.+ Memory & Storage Size & Speed ... The Internal Memory and RAM are adequate and I find the phone runs plenty fast and for me, no lagging, never freezes. A very peppy phone in my opinion.+ Marshmallows 6.01 installed and promises to later update to Nougat 7 OS when available. This I am very happy about because my Samsung J7 M model has yet to update to Marshmallow it still has Lollipop. Other J7 models should get it but I am not sure J7 M model my old one ever will.+ Camera...It is just 8MP however, I took inside and outside pictures and they came out very clear in my opinion. This is much to my happy surprise.+ Screen Resolution/Special Screen Information - For me personally, I find the resolution (at 294 PPI - Pixels Per Inch) excellent as the colors in the screen are very bright and vivid and very clear! In fact, webpages and my Kindle Reading app are just stunning on this phone! *All of my pictures and videos are crystal clear with this phone.***OUTSIDE VIEWING in Direct Sunlight with this screen... OK if I turn the screen slightly to the right because the Brightness NITS are about 400 Nits so this is good (adequate). Some more expensive phones have at least 500 Nits...some have close to 700 Nits of brightness. The higher the Brightness Nits the easier it is to see your screen in bright sunlight. * There is no way to increase the Nits on this phone but I could view it somewhat in direct sunlight.+ WiFi and 4G (LTE) (Internet)Info:WiFi Connects to any WiFi and the signal strength is excellent (even in the very back of my home and outside), most of the time I have 4 bars (outside is 3 bars).LTE (Data) When not near a router or WiFi hotspot, then I use LTE (Data) for Internet. The LTE on this phone is LIGHTENING FAST when I use data.* Note: At home, I use WiFi on my secured Router with a password. However, when I travel I use LTE Data on this phone as it is much more secure tha a Open WiFi Hot spot at say a cafe etc. This way, I know I feel more secure on the Internet.+ OTG – This phone supports On the Go with the micro USB port so I can add a 256 GB flash drive with my office files, pictures etc and the phone easily reads these files.+ Temperature of the battery and coolness of this phone - This phone and battery runs very cool with the Snapdragon 410 processor (the 600 & higher Snapdragon processors on other devices can run hot). With this phone's 410 cool processor the normal temp and most of the time it is running at 78 F degrees to 87 F degrees. When I download lots of apps or play games, it may get up to 90 degrees for a couple of minutes but goes right down to normal temps. I have run many programs on this phone and it DOES NOT OVERHEAT. I have read that some newer smart phones will sometimes get up as high as 112 degrees, this one for me has not done this.It is important to keep a phone running cooler as it will prolong the life of the phone and it is easier on the battery as well.+ Phone call Clarity/Loudness etc. - Loud enough speaker and sound is very clear, best phone I used..No matter what my location using this phone for phone calls the clarity of calls is loud and clear whether on the phone's speaker, headset or speaker.The front speaker on this phone is plenty loud...better than my Samsung J7 was!+ BATTERY LIFE: This phone has given me the very good battery life. And I use 100% brightness. For me, even at 100 brightness, if I use WiFi or Data just when I need it and then turn it off, I get close to all day into the night on one single charge! (I charge nightly and the phone is at 100% ready to go the next morning). Also to save battery, I turn off WiFi or Data and tap the ON OFF button (put to sleep). This way, I use my phone into the night on a single charge.+ EXTERNAL SLOT FOR MICRO SD CARD (UP TO 256GB SD CARD) - This helped to sell me on this phone as I can add my personal music, photos, videos and more to this phone! (I placed a 64GB SD Card in this phone and I still have room left).*Keep in mind where External SD cards are concerned: They are JUST for your personal files: music, videos, photos, and other files. When you install apps from Playstore or other sources, they store either in INTERNAL Memory Card or sometimes in the phone area (most store in the INTERNAL SD AREA). This is the law of the land where Android is concerned and ALL newer Android devices work this way when storing your downloaded apps are concerned.+ G4 Play Prints pictures and documents! I print pictures, PDF documents, Documents and more right from this phone! I have an HP Envy 4500 Wireless Printer...then I installed PrinterShare from the Playstore...I paid 10 dollars for the Premium version as the free one did not work as well. If you need more info regarding the Printing on Moto G4 Play, please ask me in comment section.+ Music Player..The installed player is Google Play Player, however, I did not like it as it used too much battery/memory so I went to Playstore and installed the free Rocket Player...this uses very little battery and memory and has lots of themes, easy to make Playlist, etc.+ MS Office...I installed free from Playstore WJS OFFICE as I need use this 100 percent compatible MS Office compatible on the road. Works great for me. I highly recommend this free Office app.+ Reading/Creating/Editing Word, Excel, Text Files and much more on this phone: I downloaded a FREE APP called WPS Office (free) which I use for Office files (it reads, edits and creates Office files). And it also reads PDF eBooks so there is no need to download a separate PDF Reader app. *This is a MUST have if you have to read PDF or Word Docs etc, my docs are crisp and clear using this app.+ Bluetooth Speed and Performance - The Bluetooth paired quickly with several devices and copied files at a great rate of speed.+ Watching Videos online...I use an app called Internet free from Playstore and also Chrome and I watch online videos by pressing the big white arrow in center of video. I have watched all the videos I wanted on several browsers just fine.For Amazon videos there is an Amazon Video app that I discovered that I use on my Android tablet to watch my Amazon videos.CONS:- Just a couple of minor Cons I found...The phone I received did not come with a headset...no problem as I already have a headset that works on this phone. (I prefer a Bluetooth headset because the sound quality us so much better). Amazon offers many plug in or Bluetooth headsets ar low prices.Also, the charger that came with the phone is a slower charger, however, I have a 2 amp charger that I use and it charges this phone quickly.Bottom line: Would I buy this phone all over again? Yes in a heartbeat as the size is perfect for me. And for the money, I believe this is the best deal out there dollar for dollar. Will this phone be a good choice for you? Yes, for two reasons.:1) Yes if you want a very easy to use phone.2) Yes if you have small hands and small fingers as the keyboard is small.If you have large hands and large fingers, this phone may be too small for you...so you should then consider a 5.5 inch or higher screen phone.***This phone I recommend to a person wants a smaller, comfortable to hold phone and also a very easy to use phone. ** Personally, I love this phone because it is fits my hands perfectly, easy to use, fun to use and it is a beautiful phone!Thank you for reading this review. I tested the phone thoroughly before I wrote this review. If you have questions about this phone please ask me in the comment section as I am a techie type and will answer right away."
 [4] "the moto g4 play is the budget option from Motorola in the 4th gen moto g series, as being under 10,000 rs is it better than its competitors? let's find out.-------------------------------------------WHATS IN THE BOX-===================1. THE G4 PLAY ITSELF2. USB CABLE3. TURBO CHARGER4. BASIC EARPHONES5. MANUALS AND WARRENTY GUIDE.------------------------------------------THE DESIGN AND SCREEN-=========================The moto g4 play has a full plastic built, it doesn't feel great like the Redmi note 3 in hand. the back and the battery are removable where you will also find the micro sd card slot and dual 4g sim card slot, it supports VoLTE my jio network worked on it just fine. the g4 play is only 137 gm so it feels very light while holding. the g4 play doesn't have the finger print scanner. the only speaker that the g4 play have is the earpiece, it works pretty well for both calls and media consumption. the 5 inch display is decent, it's only 720p but colors looks decent and vibrant, with decent amount of brightness, but the viewing angles are not that great the colors gets washed out in some angles. the display is not better than the Redmi note 3 or the coolpad note 5,but it gets the job done.-------------------------------------------------THE PERFORMENCE-===================the moto g4 play has the snapdragon 410 processor with the adreno 306 gpu and 2 gb of ram, the processor works great for day to day usage and casual gaming, it also handles heavy usage pretty well but the gaming performance is not that good, there is a lot of lagging in heavy games. the multitasking of this phone was pretty average with the 2 gb I was able to only run 4-5 apps in the background. the moto g4 play runs on the android 6.0 marshmallow with the stock android UI on top of it, the UI is very nice it doesn't have much bloatware right out of the box. I personally love the stock android looks, but many people don't like it much.-------------------------------------------THE CAMERA-=============the 8mp rear camera is pretty average, under natural lighting, the dynamic range is okay, with decent color reproduction but sometimes the exposure compensation doesn't work that good, the low light performance is pretty bad, there is a lot of noise in the images. the camera does shoot videos in 1080p resolution but again the video quality is pretty average.the front facing 5mp camera is okay the images looks a bit over saturated for me but it is nice not great.------------------------------------------THE BATTERY-================the 2800 mah battery is pretty average as well, you may get a day of battery life on moderate usage. but it is not good for heavy users or gamers. the g4 play does support fast charging and comes with the turbo charger, it takes around  2.5 or 3 hours to get fully charge.-------------------------------------------THE PROS-===========1. DECENT BUILT2. DUAL SIM WITH 4G VoLTE SUPPORT3. MICRO SD CARD SLOT4. GOOD FOR DAY TO DAY MODERATE USAGE5.  DECENT DISPLAY6. DECENT SPEAKER-THE CONS-===========1. AVERAGE CAMERA2. AVERAGE BATTERY LIFE3. NOT GOOD FOR MULTITASKING OR INTENSE GAMING4. NO FINGERPRINT SCANNER5. NO GYROSCOPE MEANS NO VR SUPPORT----------------------------------------FINAL VERDICT- the moto g4 play is a pretty average smartphone with average specs, it is only good for moderate users and those who love stock android experience, for performance wise the Redmi note 3 performs better in processing, camera, and battery performance.----------------------------------------IF YOU LIKE MY REVIEW PLEASE SUPPORT BY CLICKING ON THAT HELPFUL BUTTON, IT MEANS  ALOT.-----------------------------------------THANK YOU"  [5] "Hello guys i am using this phone from 4 month.As you all know that we all think 100 times befor e investing our hard earned money. This review can be a bit lengthy but read it fully as I explain everything.Specs: 5-inch HD display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 | 1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 quad-core processor | 2GB RAM + 16GB internal memory (expandable up to 128GB) | 8MP rear camera | 5MP front camera | 2,800 mAh batteryWhat’s good?Moto G4 Play has a great design and is easy to hold. It gets a textured plastic back and silver metal rims. The smartphone has rounded edges, and Moto branding is placed neatly at the rear. Moto G4 Play looks elegant, even though it doesn’t have a metal unibody design. Make sure you buy a back cover if you pick the white colour variant as it tends to get dirty. Plus, you won’t have to worry about accidentally spilling liquids on the phone, thanks to its water-repellent coating.Moto G4 Play has a great design and is easy to hold. It gets textured plastic back and silver metal rims.The display is vivid and sharp. However, it doesn’t make for good viewing angles in bright outdoors. I had to struggle with the display in sunlight.Moto G4 Play has a great battery life. Even though there’s 2,8000 mAh battery on paper, the battery optimisation is great. Moto G4 Play will easily last for a little more than a day from moderate to heavy usage.  Plus, it doesn’t take too much of a time to get charged.The rear camera performs decent in places where there’s ample light. The performance is at par with a lot of devices that I’ve reviewed in the same price segment. But the low-light results are grainy and pictures tend to have a lot of noise. The front camera clicks fairly good pictures.Performance isn’t an issue while multitasking and transition between tabs is swift. I mainly used it for watching YouTube videos, browsing Facebook, messaging on WhatsApp etc; and G4 Play didn’t give me a reason to complain. However, playing even the most basic games for a long duration makes the device slow. So much so that after a while you’ll find yourself playing a slow motion of CandyCrush, which you’d want to quit very soon.What’s bad?There’s nothing really wrong with the device, expect the missing fingerprint scanner and lack of full HD display. The budget segment is full of devices that offer some really good specifications at low price point, which has raised the bar.Moto G4 Play, Moto G4 Play review, Lenovo, Moto, Moto G4 Play price, Moto G4 Play features, Moto G4 Play features, Moto G4, Moto G4 Plus, budget smartphones, Android, smartphones, technology, technology newsMoto G4 Play is a decent budget smartphone that will please most buyers.VerdictMoto G4 Play is a decent budget smartphone that will please most buyers. If fingerprint scanner is not your priority in a smartphone, then go for the G4 Play. Remember, the device does lag in terms of performance, especially during gaming. Competitions to consider in the segment include – Xiaomi 3s Prime, slightly higher Redmi Note 3, LeEco Le 1s, and Lenovo K5 Note.PLEASE HIT THE HELPFUL VOTE YOUR HELPFUL VOTE HELPS A LOT"  [6] "INTRODUCTION:xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxVery recently, I was presented this opportunity to choose a mobile for my friend who can’t help himself but to forget or drop his mobile phone in a repeated fashion. His previous Nokia windows mobile kept going for long but finally succumbed to his handling manners. LOL.Thus, I was put up in a situation to find a good economically viable & VFM mobile as most of us would like to have, but before we proceed with the review ,Its always important to set our priorities straight as the final purchase process would be a way full of distractions & not just a straightforward plunge.Let’s check if my requirements are aligned to any of you as well.PRIORITIES & EXPECTATIONS FROM THE PRODUCT :xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx1.) PRIMARY USAGE :a.) Regular Priorities : Internet surfing , Video watching, VoLTE capable & a decent Camera.b.) Occasional Priorities : Sparse gaming & music on loudspeakers.2.) HANDLING AND CARE : Rough to negligent. Might be used for videos & games by kindergarten kids.3.) BUDGET : Entry level and below 10000.Must never hurt to break or lose the mobile.4.) SOCIAL STATURE : Must be well preserved with a reputed Brand name.5.) LOOKS : Must be sleek & slip resistant to hold. Must fit any shirt or jeans pocket.6.) OS & HARDWARE :a.) Bloatware free stock Android 6 or more.2 GB RAM with not less than 16 GB internal expandable microSD card.b.) Must be Dual SIM with 4G and VoLTE.c.) Good viewing angles and contrast ratio with a super responsive touchscreen.d.) Decent Autofocussing camera with LED flash & high shutter speeds.e.) Not less than 5.0 inches with HD resolutionf.) A reputed trusted brand with easy availability of service centres.g.) Decent one day Battery backup with preference to removable battery & rapid charging.h.) Slip resistant to hold, Solid loudspeakers & Decent legibility under sun.i.) Last but not the least, must be extremely rugged with corning gorilla glass protection.Now, Lets examine the Merits & De-Merits of contenders one by one:1.) SAMSUNG ON5/ON7 PRO : ( * Never Buy TFT’s )xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxPros:a.) Decent price tag of around 8000 bucks.b.) Grand Brand name & reliability of Samsung.c.) HD 720p resolution,Reputed camera & Decent Quadcore 1.3 GHz CPU & Mali T720 GPU.Cons :a.) A basic TFT display which is by no means worthy to look at.b.) No mention of any display protection like dragon tail or gorilla glass.c.) 8 GB internal memory with 1.5 GB RAM not re-assuring by any means for future upgrades.The cons with TFT screen (even for ON7),no display protection and 8 GB/1.5 GB internal memory/RAM were a big NO,so ruled out of contention.2.) Samsung J2 Pro 2016 : ( A serious Contender with S.AMOLED Display )xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxPros:a.) A 5.0 “superAmoled screen was a big plus.b.) 1.5 GHz quad core CPU with turbo speed technology to load apps faster.c.) Decent price tag of around 9000 bucks.d.) Android marshmallow & Decent low light snaps.Cons:a.) Smart glow and back cover design and plastic not upto my taste (personal preference).Overall Seems delicate to my usage.b.) No fast battery charging options.c.) Low loud speaker output.Me and my friend did not like a bit fragile & odd back design of this as a personal preference ,though On specs I would surely recommend this over any Xiaomi or entry level mobile.A sAMOLED display beats any IPS /TFT display at any given time and also conserves battery.3.) Xiaomi Redmi 3s/3s prime : ( Looks better on Specs & features but…)xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxIts Xiaomi's raining everywhere but Xiaomi’s are a bit tricky.Its phone specs may look good on paper with phenomenal 3 GB RAM and 32 GB internal memory but its memory management is not as efficient as bloatfree OS of MOTO G4 play and webpages,games & app load anytime faster on Moto’s than on the Xiaomi 3S/Primes.On Bootup/shutdown times ,games & photo editing it MOTO G4 might suffer a bit though due to lower CPU and ram configurations.Pros:a.) Higher CPU & GPU configurations.32 GB/3GB Ram vs 16 GB/2GB ram on Moto G4 play.b.) All metal build though the buttons are of plastic in contrast to metal ones on Moto G4 play.c.) Better HDR dynamic range.Selfies are wide angle with better contrast ratios.d.) Equipped with fingerprint scannerfor better security and IR blaster for any TV or AC remote functions.Gyroscope missing on G4 play.e.) Fast battery charging as in moto G4 play.Cons:a.) Both G4 play and redmi produce oversaturated colors though G4 play mostly captures with warmer color tones.b.) The metal shine wears off in a month or two from the redmi 3S primes.c.) Inferior RAM management & bloatware cluttered MIUI OS causing lag in loading of apps games and webpages. So if the primary use is just surfing or apps ,Moto G4 play is better.d.) Touch seems to be much responsive on Moto G4 play than Redmi.e.) Service center penetration of Lenovo Motorola far superior to Xiaomi.MOTO G4 PLAY FEATURES :xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx1.) A decent rugged build entry level mobile phone .A metal rim on circumference to take any impact. Corning Gorilla glass 3 protection on display with a water repellant nano coating for protection against minor liquid spillages.2.) Most amazing 10 W charger adaptor where with 15 minutes you can get 5 hours backup. charges at 5.2 V DC with 2.0 Amps of current. Charger has a USB port where a dual data/power cable could be connected.3.) OTG enabled usb port & super responsive 5.0”HD IPS wide angle display with 294 PPI . clutter free Android 6(Marshmallow) OS updateable to Android 7 (Nougat) ,loads apps, games, webpages super fast.4.) Dual SIM 4G & VoLTE support on both SIMs.5.) 9.9 mm Thin profile with textured anti-slip back and 137 gms in weight.6.) Lighter Li-Po 2800 mAh battery with easy 1 days backup.7.) Decent 8MP autofocussing f/2.2 primary camera with LED flash & fast shutter speeds .manual exposure control on the Fly is additional advantage. Pics may get overexposed at times and low light snaps may not be the best but again clarity is good.8.) Sun legibility is quite OK but not as good as on other Xiaomi or J2 pro 2016.9.) No gyroscope, fingerprint sensor or IR blaster to add to the feature richness.10.) A Quadcore 1.2 GHz CPU with 2 GB ram against octacores /3 GB RAMs in Xiaomis .Its effect though hardly noticeable in routine operations except Bootup/Shutdown times, High end gamings or any other CPU/GPU intensive jobs like Photo editing.11.) Front situated Loudspeakers superb Loud and clear unlike rear placed on Xiaomi mobiles.12.) Service center penetration better to Xiaomi’s but inferior to Samsung.OVERALL VERDICT FOR MOTO G4 PLAY :xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxFor those looking for a cheap and best reputed branded, rugged good VFM mobile with Rapid charging, Decent camera with good clarity, Loud and clear Loudspeakers ,HD IPS wide angle, super responsive display and blazing fast loading of apps & webpages, Moto G4 play is the best choice.Its an entry level mobile so do not expect Flagship model performances.Its quite good for all basic functions with decent hardwares.It meets serious competition from the SuperAMOLED equipped Samsung J2 pro 2016 and feature rich Xiaomi Redmi mobiles at a little extra cost.However, at the end of the day, It’s a matter of personal preference ,usage & expenditure since we all know there’s always something better to buy with an extra money.***You may like to go for better feature laden Moto G4 plus for a little extra***xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxFYI, I myself own a 64 GB Samsung S6 edge which was more than 6 times the Moto G4 play’s cost but if you ask me in terms of VFM today ,I don’t see the superiority of S6 over G4 or for instance MOTO G4 plus  in the same proportion. So finally its your wise decision to make based upon your priorities."  [7] "First of ,thanks to Amazon for delivering the product real quick.For first impression ,I would say that it looks far better than I thought.The side aluminium/metal frame looks very premium.Also the device feels very lightweight in hands.The battery here is removable ,unlike old Moto devices.I am totally satisfied with the build quality and overall finishing.A very well made product.INBOX CONTENTS:1-Handset2-Battery3-Ton of manual and user guide4-Normal old school earphones5-Fast charger and USB cable----------------------------------------------NOW COMING TO MY REVIEW-----------------------------------------------#=THE BUILD QUALITY as I said is really good, well its Motorola!.The power button and the volume control button uses metallic material with good grip.Unlike the cheep plastic ones.Power button is above the volume button ,which may not be that handy for some users.But don't worry ,you will get used to it.Anyway the buttons provide excellent feedback.The navigation buttons are on-screen type and lacks hardware keys.Display is quite bright and clear.Because its 5 inch a HD screen is enough.You would hardly notice any pixelation ,unless you look really close.#=UI AND PERFORMANCE - As usual with every moto device ,The moto G play also comes with stock android.Which is basically the selling point of moto devices. Because you get fast OS updates.Even though ,the device is shipped with Marshmallow.It will get the Nougat update real soon.It is equipped with snapdragon 410 which is quite outdated now and fits in low end category.Despite that the UI experience is very smooth in moto g play.Well I remember my old grand prime had the same chipset.At that time it use to run most of the games with ease.I installed quite a few basic games in Gplay and found it is still capable of running some decent graphics rich games.The animations were at 1X when  got it,I turned it down to 0.5X using developer options and now it seems much faster and fluid.#CAMERA is Okey ,I never expected it to perform exceptional with camera because it comes with a low end sensor.But anyways it is capable of taking some decent shots which are very similar to on5 pro and better than K5 plus.The front snapper is also decent and snaps some bright selfies.Overall I think the camera is decent for the asking price.Note:Low light performance is below average.#BATTERY LIFE It comes with 2800mah battery which is quite enough because there is nothing that will consume too much battery.So i hope it will last for a full working day.After using it for one day ,I think I got more than 6 hours of On screen time because today is the first day So,I was checking out all the features.Anyway I will comment more about the battery life after 2-3 days.#NETWORK I mainly bought it to use JIO 4G ,because this phone supports true 4G.Yes you can make VoLTE calls and use 4G data.The speed it offers is really good.Totally satisfied with my purchase.Conclusion----------------This is for those people who need good battery life ,decent performance for basic day to day tasks ,good call quality and ofcourse a phone with good build quality and after sales support.The camera is enough for basic picture snapping.Overall I am really satisfied with my purchase.This phone really exceeded my expectations.Thanks I hope you like my review.If you have any further queries then feel free to comment down below.Abraham Joseph" Thumbs up for that.Second best thing is the 'stock android' experience. No nonsense, useless apps. This keeps the phone clean and healthy on memory and I can always download extra apps from app store if I choose to do so.Screen's colour calibration and brightness levels are on par with industry standard these days.This phone packs enough battery life to last for over a day, the way you use. My daily usage for a week's test was restricted to social media, emails, voice calls, YouTube (heavy usage :P), camera. Also, keeping data off when not needed saves on battery.  [9] "DesignPro: The Moto G4 is lightweight and packed with solid hardware.Con: Missing features like NFC are kind of a bummer.DisplayPro: By making the display smaller in the G4 Play, it makes the device easier to grip.Con: Unfortunately, the display has a lower resolution — which makes it less sharp than the other G4 devicesUser InterfacePro: The lack of clutter in the operating system makes the G4 Play much more intuitive than other Android devices.Con: The lack of bells and whistles makes it less appealing to consumers that want higher end smartphones. For example, you won’t be able to record in 4K using the G4 Play nor does it have a fingerprint sensor.ProcessorPro: The Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor is sufficient for handling productive tasks using the G4 Play.Con: It is unfortunate that the G4 Play has an outdated processor instead of a new one.RAMPro: 2GB is a solid amount of RAM especially for a device that has a starting price of Rs.8999Con: Even though the amount of RAM integrated in the device is substantial, the CPU is what drives the speed and that is slightly outdated.CameraPro: Having 8 megapixels on the back and 5 megapixels on the front is a solid offering.Con: The camera on the Moto G4 Play tends to struggle in low light conditions and the video recordings can be a bit shaky.BatteryPro: The 2,800 mAh battery ensures that you could have as much as a day or a day and a half of phone usage available.Con: The charger that comes with the G4 Play embedded so you can detach the USB cable and connect it to your computer. I would recommend buying a separate Quick Charge 2.0 charger instead of using the one that comes in the box.StoragePro: The ability to expand up to 128GB using a microSD card is convenient. This means you can save a ton of music, photos and video files on the device with the additional storage. Plus Google offers unlimited photo storage through Google Photos, which is seamlessly integrated into the Moto G4 Play.Con: The internal storage options seem to be on the lower end of the scale for smartphones for what you would expect in 2016. Storage tiers offered by other smartphones generally start at 32GB and then go as high as 256GB.Overall ImpressionIf you are looking for a smartphone at a low cost, then the Moto G4 Play pros outweigh the cons. With a starting price of Rs.8999 unlocked and support for all four major U.S. carriers, it seems tough for other manufacturers to beat the Moto G4.There are some minor differences that the lower cost G4 Play has from the G4 and G4 Plus. For example, the G4 Play does not support the karate chop shortcut motion for turning on the flashlight. But if you manage what to expect from a smartphone due to the low cost, then you will likely be satisfied. I actually recommend this device for someone that is on a budget, someone that is getting a smartphone for the first time or someone that is switching from a feature phone for the first time." [10] "I'm going to compare this to the Moto E3 Power so that everyone can decide whether to give 1,000 bucks moreI will judge the phones on 5 factors:1.Build2.Display3.Performance4.Camera5.BatteryBuild Quality-Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play look quite similar to each other. Both feature a plastic body with a sort of textured finish. But the Moto E3 Power houses a separate speaker grill at the bottom bezels while the Moto G4 Play has a mono grill at the top for the earpiece and speaker. The sound output is better on E3 Power due to the dedicated speaker grill.The back of Moto E3 Power lacks a textured finish while the Moto G4 Play has a texture design on back, making it easy to hold in hand.Display-Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play feature a 5\" inch 720 x 1280 pixels 294 ppi pixel density display. It's fairly bright and offers great contrast thanks to the low black levels. Sunlight legibility is also good.The viewing angles are great as well.Both the phones have Corning Gorilla Glass 3 Protection and Nano Coating which makes them splash proof or accidental water spillings.While the Moto G4 Play has the Moto Display and other Moto Actions, the E3 Power doesn't have them since it doesn't have the Moto App.Performance-Here things take a kind of a ugly turn.The E3 Power runs on a MediaTek 6735P QuadCore CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1GHz and a Mali-T720 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 1.1GB to be free. Switching between apps and multi-tasking is fluid. The phone has noticeable lags on heavy usage. The device performs poorly on heavy gaming, although midrange games like Subway Surfers run well without any issues. No heating issues as well.The G4 Play runs on a Snapdragon 410 Quad Core CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1.2GHz and a Adreno 306 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 900 MB to be free. Ram management seems poor on G4 Play as compared to E3 Power as the usage seems to be more. But surprisingly the device fares better to E3 Power in terms of multi-tasking and Gaming due to a powerful CPU. Asphalt 8 runs smoothly without any issue. The device heats upto 38.C to 40.C which isn't always an issue.Camera-Both the E3 Power and G4 Play house a 8MP Rear and 5MP Front facing Camera. The performance is above average in daylight and proper lighting conditions. The Camera performs average in night and low light. The flash is really helpful in low light. The device runs Moto's Stock Camera app with a Shutter button. You can use the exposure mode, Panoroma, HDR or Video Modes. While the E3 Power can only record 720p videos, G4 Play can record upto 1080p videos. The Camera focusing on E3 Power is better than that of G4 Play, so is the post image processing but the shutter speed is better in G4 Play.The Selfie Camera will really delight you. You can always use a 3rd Party filter app on the both these devices to take some neat selfies.Battery-While the E3 Power comes with a 3500maH battery, the G4 Play comes with a 2800maH battery. The battery on E3 Power is nothing short to incredible and easily lasts for a day with moderate usage. and last over 1.5 days but with heavy usage lasts only upto 9 to 10 hours.. You can get screen on-time of 8 to 9 hours easily. The rapid charger bundled with the phone takes 2 to 3 hours to fully charge the device from 0%.The G4 Play lasts upto a day with moderate usage but with heavy usage lasts only upto 7 to 8 hours. The G4 Play also comes with the rapid charger and the charging takes around 3 hours.Both the phones feature a removable battery.However the battery life on the E3 Power has reduced after a software updateBugs- The Moto E3 Power has a major bugWhen you plug an OTG cable in and use a pendrive or connect anything via OTG, after unplugging itit will nit charge. You need to restart the phone to make it work. However, this has been fixed with a software updateIt comes with Voice over LTE (VOLTE) out of the box.It does not have the Moto App so you wont get the Moto Actions or Moto Display.Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play run of Stock Android version of Android 6.0 Marshmallow with Minor Tweaks by Motorola. Although the E3 Power is a month old, it won't get the Android Nougat 7.0 update which is a huge disappointment for budget users, while the G4 Play will get Android 7.0 Nougat Update.Conclusion-If you are a light user and want better battery life and don't care much about software updates go for the E3 PowerBut if you are a heavy user and you want better gaming and software updates, go for the G4 PlayAfter all, good smartphones have become cheaper and cheap smartphones have got really good.And we no longer judge a phone by how good they are. Instead we judge them by how bad they are or how many flaws do they have.P.S. I had recently received a call from Motorola where we had a long talk regarding the Nougat update for Moto E3 Power. I had asked them to release the update for it. They said they are still testing it and they might release it soon."  [8] "First of all, this review was written after many days of research and observations. So hoping you all appreciate it.--------------PROS:--------------(+) MICRO SIM CARD -- While Nano Sims are gradually being the standard SIM size and are the size for all the phones that are recently launched in the marker, where as I still like this size.Note to Nano SIM users: You can install a Nano SIM in this phone if you carefully place it into an adapter or just go to your phone store and they can move your info from your Nano Card to a new Micro SIM card. Be sure you have a new Micro SIM with you in case they do not have one.(+) Size, Weight, and Comfort of the Phone of the phone is bliss...This 5 inch screen, weight of the phone, comfort while holding this phone are prior reasons why I bought this phone. I had a huge 5.5 Samsung J7 (2015). It was too big for my small hands and very uncomfortable to hold. where as  the G4 Play is a lighter weight phone and not bulky.This phone fits my hand perfectly and comfortable to hold.(+) Memory/Storage has 16GB Internal however after space taken from operating system and factory apps 10.6 GB is left for your personal use . External card slot can handle up to 256GB well advised to expand upto 128GB.There is no bloatware...pure stock Android experience...About twenty one essential factory Installed apps including Phone and Help. Most of the apps are Google Apps. Only about six Motorola apps which includes the Camera, File Manager, FM Radio, Phone, Settings and Calc. Motorola allows Android and Google to supply just the Apps you need, however, later on you can install Apps you like as there is plenty of space for apps to install.Because I just installed Apps I wanted like Facebook, Twitter, Messenger and other large Apps, I still have 8.25 GB Internal Storage now left if I want to add more apps later on.(+) Memory & Storage Size & Speed ... The Internal Memory and RAM are adequate and I find the phone runs fast and for me, no lags or frame drops  never freezes. A very peppy phone in my opinion. I have tested games like Modern Combat 5 and Asphalt 8 which runs pretty smooth as per budget.(+) Marshmallows 6.01 installed and company or developers promises to later update to Nougat 7 OS when available. This is where I am very happy because other phones at this budget doesn't provide Nougat update and some doesn't even provide Marshmallow.(+) Camera...It is just 8MP however, I took inside and outside pictures and they came out very clear in my opinion. This is much to my happy surprise. Low light photography is below average but again the price is not much so acceptable.(+) Screen Resolution - For me personally, I find the resolution (at 294 PPI - Pixels Per Inch) excellent as the colors in the screen are very bright and vivid and very clear with a good color gamut! In fact, webpages and my Kindle Reading app are just stunning on this phone! *All of my pictures and videos are crystal clear with this phone, thumbs up for the display .***OUTSIDE VIEWING in Direct Sunlight with this screen... OK if I turn the screen slightly to the right because the Brightness NITS are about 400 Nits so this is good (adequate). Some more expensive phones have at least 500 Nits...some have close to 700 Nits of brightness. The higher the Brightness Nits the easier it is to see your screen in bright sunlight. * There is no way to increase the Nits on this phone but I could view it somewhat in direct sunlight so sunlight readability is great on this device.(+) WiFi and 4G (LTE)......WiFi Connects to any WiFi and the signal strength is excellent gets to connect with weak signals also, most of the time I have 4 bars (outside is 3 bars).LTE (Data) When not near a router or WiFi hotspot, then I use LTE (Data) for Internet. The LTE on this phone is LIGHTENING FAST when I use data and speeds go high up when you are at a open air.(+) OTG – This phone supports On the Go with the micro USB port so I can add a 256 GB flash drive with my pictures etc and the phone easily reads these files and external hard drives are also supported.(+) Temperature of the battery....... This phone and battery runs very cool with the Snapdragon 410 processor (the 600 & higher Snapdragon processors on other devices can run hot). With this phone's 410 cool processor the normal temp and most of the time it is running at 78 F degrees to 87 F degrees. When I download lots of apps or play games, it may get up to 90 degrees for a couple of minutes but goes right down to normal temps. I have run many programs on this phone and it DOES NOT OVERHEAT. I have read that some newer smart phones will sometimes get up as high as 112 degrees, this one for me has not done this.It is important to keep a phone running cooler as it will prolong the life of the phone and it is easier on the battery as well.(+) Phone call Clarity/Loudness etc. - Loud enough speaker and sound is very crisp and clear, best phone I used..No matter what my location using this phone for phone calls the clarity of calls is loud and clear whether on the phone's speaker, headset or speaker.The front speaker on this phone is plenty loud.(+) BATTERY LIFE: This phone has given me the very good battery life. And I use 100% brightness. For me, even at 100 brightness, if I use WiFi or Data just when I need it and then turn it off, I get close to all day into the night on one single charge! (I charge nightly and the phone is at 100% ready to go the next morning). Also to save battery, I turn off WiFi or Data and tap the ON OFF button (put to sleep). This way, I use my phone into the night on a single charge.(+) EXTERNAL SLOT FOR MICRO SD CARD - This helped to sell me on this phone as I can add my personal music, photos, videos and more to this phone! (I placed a 64GB SD Card in this phone and I still have room left).*Keep in mind where External SD cards are concerned: They are JUST for your personal files: music, videos, photos, and other files. When you install apps from Playstore or other sources, they store either in INTERNAL Memory Card or sometimes in the phone area (most store in the INTERNAL SD AREA). This is the law of the land where Android is concerned and ALL newer Android devices work this way when storing your downloaded apps.(+) Bluetooth Speed and Performance - The Bluetooth paired quickly with several devices and copied files at a great rate of speed.----------CONS:----------(-) Just a couple of minor Cons I found...The phone I received did not come with a headset...no problem as I already have a headset that works on this phone. (I prefer a Bluetooth headset because the sound quality us so much better). Amazon offers many plug in or Bluetooth headsets ar low prices.Also, the charger that came with the phone is a slower charger, however, I have a 2 amp charger that I use and it charges this phone quickly.Bottom line: Would I buy this phone all over again? Yes in a heartbeat as the size is perfect for me. And for the money, I believe this is the best deal out there dollar for dollar. Will this phone be a good choice for you? Yes, for two reasons.:1) Yes if you want a very easy to use phone.2) Yes if you have small hands and small fingers as the keyboard is small.If you have large hands and large fingers, this phone may be too small for you...so you should then consider a 5.5 inch or higher screen phone.***This phone I recommend to a person wants a smaller, comfortable to hold phone and also a very easy to use phone. ** Personally, I love this phone because it is fits my hands perfectly, easy to use, fun to use and it is a beautiful phone!Thank you for reading this review. I tested the phone thoroughly before I wrote this review. If you have questions about this phone please ask me in the comment section.Jai Hind"

[10] "Motorola's Moto G4 Play is the most affordable phone in the G4 line. It's splash-resistant, comes loaded with a near stock version of Android 6.0, has great battery life but The G4 Play lags when playing games and taking panoramic photos. The display can be hard to read in direct sunlight and you won't be able to customize the phone using Motorola's Moto Maker website.If you're on the hunt for an affordable phone with pretty long battery life, the Motorola Moto G4 Play deserves your attention. But the regular Moto G4 gives you even better features for just a little more cash.Rate this review helpful if it helped you in anyway."

 [7] "The Moto G4 Play is basically the same hardware as the Moto G 2015 in a new design. The build quality is great, although with metal phones becoming standard in this segment, the plastic does come off looking not as premium. The phone itself works flawlessly, but there are too many limitations to justify its cost.The main drawback with this handset is the older hardware, which means you're not going to see a lot of updates. For three years, Motorola has shown that it will roll out updates to its Moto G and even Moto E phones nearly as fast as Google does for its Nexus line. But that won't be the base for the Moto G4 Play. The Snapdragon 410 SoC severely limits its ability to receive updates, as it is already a two-year-old SoC by now.You're much better off buying the Redmi Note 3. The Snapdragon 650 is newer and runs rings around this handset (as well as the costlier Moto G4 Plus), and the build quality is much nicer."

 [6] "I bought this on Amazon for 8999/- This is a mid range phone 4G from Motorola (now Lenovo Owned) with a decent range of specifications (Snapdragon 410 and Quad Core - 1.2 Ghz) and good build quality for a budget phone. I bought this in white and it looks quite good though obviously tends to show dirt and stains faster. The back panel has a nice grippy textured feel to it which feels great to hold.I've been using this for about a week now and its been a mixed bag of reactions towards the Moto G Play. While build quality and hardware remains good for the price, the specifications and camera do leave you wanting a bit more at times. Compares equally with other phones in the same range.Pros:1) The Build quality is very good. Motorola have not compromised on hardware even at this price and the buttons feel robust and firm. The steel band around the outer chassis feels well put together. The power button which is oddly placed above the volume rocker has a nice lined grip to it.2) Audio quality is good, not great. The ringer is adequate though in a noisy environment you could miss hearing it. The speaker and mic are good enough, clarity is excellent and the mic does not pick up in-necessary noise from the surroundings. It also has a tiny noise cancelling mic (or ambient noise sensor) at the rear near the camera which helps I guess.3) Camera is average. With a 8MP rear facing and 5 MP front selfie camera which is the norm for most budget phones, the pictures are crisp clear and more than enough for daytime or brightly lit subjects. Sadly night shots which require the flash are grainy, have a lot of noise and are just about average with a lot of details not showing through.4) Software & Specs. The phone comes with Android Marshmallow out of the box. v6.0.1. Being a Motorola it is not loaded with bloatware of any kind (which is just awesome) and runs the stock OS. So, the memory remains nice & clean, nothing to delete and the phone runs great.5) The phone comes with the standard range of accessories in the Box, a quick charger 10W (0-60% in 25 mins) which doubles as the data cable, a set of instruction manuals with warranty conditions. No headphones supplied.6) Screen. With a 5\" IPS LCD the display is bright and clear though not very crisp like some of the new HD displays. It is fairly readable in bright sunlight and has a good touch response.7) Battery Life. With a removable 2800 mAh battery, the phone easily lasts a day or more with moderate to heavy usage at times. Charges quickly enough with the supplied charger and battery drain is fairly slow even during intensive gaming and other apps usage.The best part is that the phone has a water repellant Nano Coating to it so even a little bit of water or splashes wont damage it. As well as Corning Gorilla Glass 3. *As claimed by Motorola.Cons: Nothing much to be negative about, the phone performs flawlessly as expected. So far no hanging, normal levels of heating with some random gaming, internet, You Tube and WhatsApp on all the time.A good buy at this price, nothing special compared to other phones in the same price bracket. Buy if for solid and long lasting build quality and a clutter free Android OS. Not to mention now that Lenovo has bought over Motorola, there are plenty of service centers all over."

ABOVE ALL...Amazing price deal by AMAZON that too on EMI. It's a standby phone for me and I don't have a thing to complain about."  [7] "Bought it as a gift for my wife. The specs everyone might be aware of so I won't input those in my review. I'll just note the pro's and con's of this phone.Pro's:-2800mah battery, lasts for a day on 3g and WiFi continuously-display and UI are great-camera clarity is okay for the price paid. Front cam of 5mp is enough for imo calls and selfies-moto service center is there in most cities and they do try and help with the issues(from my past experiences)-android marshmallow is smooth-stock android-quite and old version but still we get a snapdragon processor from a renowned brand-2GB RAM and 16GB internal memory for an average user-supports voice LTE-water repellent screen( not water resistant)-gorilla glass(get a screen guard though as an extra protection)Con's:-the moto headset is not so great-plasticky look. Design is average-clock speed is a bit low but for the price it is okay-cant play any heavy games on this one(I won't recommend it if you are a person who wants to use this phone for a long time)-updates won't roll out faster on this one compared to the other models. Android Nougat might not be available for this one because of the old processor.-no fingerprint sensor might be a con for most people.-voice clarity is a bit low compared to some other handsetsBeing a person who is a very light user, I love this one. For the price, the spec we get are pretty good. There are several other brand of phones offering a lot of cooler spec for the same price. But for a person who prefers the durability of the brand, availability of service centers and the processor type, this is the best choice available. Better than the moto e3 power as we get a better processor for the price paid. In the end it is a personal choice as to which phone we want to buy. Also there's no easy return of phones once you buy it, so do research properly before buying. If there are any questions related to the phone, I'll be happy to answer those.Hope I've helped. I wish the people who are planning to buy a phone find the right phone which suits their needs.(using this handset for 15 days only, I'll update the review after sometime if I find any new advantages/con's)"

[10] "Great phone, with good performance and clutter free Android."                                                      
 [1] "Lot of people has written about pros, which are true to some extent. What I am experiencing is not written in any review.It is one of the smoothest experience with Android, so no complaints here. I don't see any Nougat update available yet.Cons1) BatteryBiggest problem for me is battery life. For my usage I don't see its reliable enough for \"Smartphone use case\".If you are call and SMS person then it might be enough.Battery life is not good if you have on 4G Data Sim with Volte and Another one just for regular Voice CallsOnly apps running in backgrounds are WhatsApp, Google Map, PayTM, HotStar.If you start your day at 7 AM with 100% battery, by 10 PM in night with light use Wi-Fi + 4G Data along with Location/GPS on all the time,battery drops to less than 25% easily. If you watch YouTube videos then surely less than 10%.So if you forget to put charger at night, phone would switch off during night. So no alarm for next day morning.Only saving grace is fast charger which charges battery really quickly for me I can see its getting charged to 100% in around 60-70 minutesSo my advice to carry charger or battery bank all the time with you, since if you change any usage pattern phone might die during your day usage.2) WeightIt is relatively light weight, but it is not weight balanced, so there is chance that you might drop3) Slot DesignMost problematic design is micro SIM slots and Micro SD card slot.Main Problem with micro SIM slot is very difficult to take SIM out. Which might not be problem if you don't switch SIM frequently.Weirdest design is First micro SIM and Micro SD Card slot are stacked on top of each other. So it really makes difficult to take out first SIM and micro SD Card.There is one small notch for SIM one ejection, but it barely moves SIM out of slot by couple of millimeters, so you struggle to pull SIM out.Taking micro SIM out from both slot is some series exercise as you don't want to damage micro SIM or micro SIM slot.4) HeadphoneHeadphone is very basic. Cheaper Redmi models have much better headphone5) CameraCamera is basic. Taking photos in room lit with tube lights is problem for the rear camera. Video shooting is way below average.6) SpeakerSpeaker is very basic. Not loud enough for the most of YouTube videos.7) VOLTEVolte works only on SIM1,  It means dual 4G in real sense is SIM1 only 4G VOLTE calls, SIM2 is for 4G Data + non VOLTE calls8) SARSAR value is not clearly mentioned in any review. Got a paper in box which is stating SAR as 1.36 is very high considering it does not have metal cover.For Plastic body it should have less than 0.8So Motorola/Lenovo has not put any design efforts to reduce SAR RadiationXiomi Redmi is clearly better option if you don't need two SIM + dedicated Micro SD slot.After using for two months I am finding Glass is getting scratched with regular use, not sure what kind of Gorilla Glass is really used"

 [6] "--------------------------------------------------------Moto G Play (4th Gen) Specifications:--------------------------------------------------------a) Display: 5.0” 720p HD (1280×720), 294 ppib) Dimensions: Height: 144.4 mm / Width: 72 mm / Depth: 8.95 mm to 9.9 mmc) Weight: 137gd) Operating System: ndroid(TM) 6.0.1, Marshmallowe) System Architecture/Processor: Up to 1.2 GHz, Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ 410 quad-core processor with 450 MHz Adreno 306 GPUf) RAM: 2GB3g) ROM: 16 GB internal1, up to 128 GB microSD Card supporth) Battery: 2800 mAh, 10W quick charger gives 5 hours of power in only 15 mins of chargei) Rear Camera: 8 MP, f/2.2 aperture, LED flash, Tap (anywhere) to capture, 4X digital zoom, Burst mode, Auto HDR, Panorama, Drag to focus & exposure, 1080p HD video (30 fps)j) Front Camera: 5 MP, f/2.2 aperture, Display flash, Beautification mode, Best shot, ideo Capture 1080p, 30fps)k) SIM Card: Micro-SIM, nano-SIM with an adaptorl) Connectivity: Micro USB, 3.5mm headset jack, Bluetooth version 4.1 LE, Wi-Fi: 802.11 b/g/n (2.4 GHz)m) Networks: 4G LTE (VoLTE), UMTS / HSPA+, GSM / EDGEn) Water Protection: Water repellent nano-coatingo) Sensors: Accelerometer, Proximity, Ambient Lightp) Base Color: Black or whiteq) Moto G Play Price in India: INR 8999• Key Specifications:Mot G Play  4th Gen has 5″ HD display. It  is powered by Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ 410 processor with quad-core CPU and has 4G VoLTE capabilities. G Play (4th Gen) is equipped with upto 2GB RAM and 16 GB internal storage expandable to 128 GB microSD Card support. It has 2800mAh battery and comes with a 10W Rapid Charger that can charge the Moto G Play for upto  5 hours in just 15 minutes.Moto G Play 4th Gen will be available in Black and White colour options.• Camera:The rear camera is 8 MP camera and the front camera is 5MP. The rear camera has ƒ/2.2 aperture and a a camera sensor that uses larger-than-average pixels. It  shoots photos and videos at 30fps in 1080p.  The 5MP front facing camera has beautification mode and Best Shot mode to help the user take better selfies.• Durability:For durability, the Moto G Play has a water-repellent nano-coating that can protect it from minor spills and splashes of water.• Battery:With a 2800 mAh battery, you can go from morning to night without worrying about battery life.Moto G Play, 4th Gen comes with the 10W rapid charger, which gives you 5 hours of battery life in just 15 minutes of charging.• 4G Volte Speed:The new Moto G Play, 4th Gen runs at 4G speed and supports VOLTE, so you can get to the good stuff faster. Stream videos and music smoothly without any annoying stops and starts. And browse the web without waiting for pages to load.-------------------------------------------------------------------Reasons to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Pros):-------------------------------------------------------------------1. The display resolution is only a HD panel but because of the smaller 5 inch size the pixel density is higher than a 5.5 inch. Color representation, saturation and brightness are evenly balanced with good viewing angles.2. Its processor is powered by a 1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 chipset which is kind of decent.3. Along with that it comes with a primary memory of 2 GB. Now compared to its counterparts its more than enough as Moto devices are completely bloatware free.4. Next Moto G4 Play pros is that for gaming the graphics is powered by Adreno 306 which runs many of the high end games smoothly.5. Consumers buy Motorola smartphones primarily for their clean software. And yes this one is absolutely clean which is almost stock Android. The version of the Marshmallow 6.0.1 which is currently the latest one.6. While many smartphones are ditching their memory card slot, this smartphone has a got dedicated one. It can be expanded up to 128 GB with the help of a microSD card.7. Another Moto G4 Play pros is the nano coating over the smartphone display provides water repellent feature. (But remember that this is not water resistant).8. The battery capacity is of 2800 mAh which is enough for a 5 inch screen smartphone to last throughout the day even for an avid user.9. For the protection of the display it comes with a Corning Gorilla 3.10. And yes it has a fast battery charging technology, not Quick Charge though but with a 10 watt rapid charger.--------------------------------------------------------------------------Reasons Not to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Cons):--------------------------------------------------------------------------1. The first is the quality of both the 8 megapixel primary camera and 5 megapixel secondary camera is not good in low light condition. The LED flash helps a little but not much to remove grains. The reason is because of the smaller f/2.2 focal aperture.2. Next Moto G4 Play cons is that despite being a small 5 inch smartphone it still feels bulky due to the thickness of 9.9 mm. This is too thick in today’s standard.3. At the current price tag there are dozens of smartphones that does comes with a fingerprint sensor, but this one ain’t got one.4. Another Moto G Play 4th Gen cons is that there is no dedicated navigational touch buttons below the screen. The screen is already a small one and the navigation’s are all placed on the screen itself.5. And finally the last Moto G Play (4th Gen) cons is that there is no gyroscope sensor."

However to my surprise I was told that the tech support was dissolved recently - this is after me installing the SMARTchk app and not finding any issue.When I took it to the MOTO care, it tool me about 2.5 hours to get my turn as there were several other customer with a range of issue - I was very surprised to know that there were many like me with brand new phone. When I got my slot, I was told that they will do a software update and this took another hours and did not make any difference. All this time AMAZON kept saying that I should get a DOU from the customer care and then they will replace the phone - always indicating that it is straight forward. I am disappointed at AMAZON as they were not being frank here.The actual process is that the MOTO care took my phone and escalate this to MOTOROLA. Based on their response, they will decide if a replacement can be given. So I paid for a new phone and cant use it, had to waste my entire day to get my phone fixed. [10] "#designPro: The Moto G4 is lightweight and packed with solid hardware.Con: Missing features like NFC are kind of a bummer.#DisplayPro: By making the display smaller in the G4 Play, it makes the device easier to grip.Con: Unfortunately, the display has a lower resolution — which makes it less sharp than the other G4 devices.#User InterfacePro: The lack of clutter in the operating system makes the G4 Play much more intuitive than other Android devices.Con: The lack of bells and whistles makes it less appealing to consumers that want higher end smartphones. For example, you won’t be able to record in 4K using the G4 Play nor does it have a fingerprint sensor.#ProcessorPro: The Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor is sufficient for handling productive tasks using the G4 Play.Con: It is unfortunate that the G4 Play has an outdated processor instead of a new one.#RAMPro: 2GB is a solid amount of RAM especially for a device that has a starting price of $99.Con: Even though the amount of RAM integrated in the device is substantial, the CPU is what drives the speed and that is slightly outdated.#CameraPro: Having 8 megapixels on the back and 5 megapixels on the front with a starting price of $99 is a solid offering.Con: The camera on the Moto G4 Play tends to struggle in low light conditions and the video recordings can be a bit shaky.#BatteryPro: The 2,800 mAh battery ensures that you could have as much as a day or a day and a half of phone usage available.Con: The charger that comes with the G4 Play embedded so you can detach the USB cable and connect it to your computer. I would recommend buying a separate Quick Charge 2.0 charger instead of using the one that comes in the box.#StoragePro: The ability to expand up to 128GB using a microSD card is convenient. This means you can save a ton of music, photos and video files on the device with the additional storage. Plus Google offers unlimited photo storage through Google Photos, which is seamlessly integrated into the Moto G4 Play.Con: The internal storage options seem to be on the lower end of the scale for smartphones for what you would expect in 2016. Storage tiers offered by other smartphones generally start at 32GB and then go as high as 256GB.Overall ImpressionIf you are looking for a smartphone at a low cost, then the Moto G4 Play pros outweigh the cons. With a starting price of $99.99 unlocked and support for all four major U.S. carriers, it seems tough for other manufacturers to beat the Moto G4.There are some minor differences that the lower cost G4 Play has from the G4 and G4 Plus. For example, the G4 Play does not support the karate chop shortcut motion for turning on the flashlight. But if you manage what to expect from a smartphone due to the low cost, then you will likely be satisfied. I actually recommend this device for someone that is on a budget, someone that is getting a smartphone for the first time or someone that is switching from a feature phone for the first time."

[10] "This phone definitely delivers a lot more than its asking price !I use the phone mainly for emails, social media and of course to make phone calls and it is flawless and very snappy, thanks to the pure  version of Android.The IPS display is great and very easy on the eyes unlike some of the AMOLED screens of which I'm not a big fan. Text looks great and not pixelated at all.Touch is very sensitive and has a great feel to it.Battery is more than enough to get your day covered. On moderate to heavy use it wouldn't be a problem to get it through the day.I don't use the phone for gaming and so can't comment on that. But simple gaming shouldn't be a problem.Didn't face any issue with WIFI and Bluetooth. Speed of WIFI is  good as well.And finally, I've been using the phone for a week now and absolutely no heating issues so far. The phone remains surprisingly cool even when I use it while it is charging.Edit after using for about 3 weeks now..Still agree with all the points mentioned above.Rear camera is adequate outside in day light but suffers greatly for indoor shots or less lit area. Also camera not good enough for scanning purpose to use with apps like Genius scan.GPS was having trouble finding satellites inside car. I had to put it beside the car's front glass for reception and still it was little sluhgish. My old iPhone 4s used to work great even if I had it in the front rear seat or cup holder near the gear area.But we are talking about a 9000 rupees phone with good brand value.On balance, I'm still totally satisfied with my purchase considering its snappy experience, good screen, great battery life, absolutely no heating issues and pretty quick charging.However if camera is your top most priority, then you might want to keep looking."

 [2] "HELLO FRIENDS MOTO G4 PLAY IS A STYLISH PHONE AND HAVING PRETTY DECENT SPECS TOO.THIS IS MY HONEST REVIEW AND MY EXPERIENCE WITH THE DEVICE.IN THE BOX1.THE G4 PLAY ITSELF2. USB CABLE3. TURBO CHARGER4. BASIC EARPHONES5. MANUALS AND WARRENTY GUIDEDESIGN AND SCREENThe Moto g4 play has a full plastic built. The back and the battery are removable where you will also find the micro SD card slot and dual 4g SIM card slot, it supports VoLTE my jio network worked on it just fine. Feels very light while holding. It doesn't have the finger print scanner. it works pretty well for both calls and media consumption. The 5 inch display is decent, it's only 720p but colours looks decent and vibrant, with decent amount of brightness, but the viewing angles are not that great the colours gets washed out in some angles. The display is not better than the Redmi note 3 or the coolpad note 5, but it gets the job done.PERFORMANCEthe Moto g4 play has the snapdragon 410 processor with the ADRENO 306 GPU and 2 GB of ram, the processor works great for day to day usage and casual gaming, it also handles heavy usage pretty well but the gaming performance is not that good, there is a lot of lagging in heavy games. The multitasking of this phone was pretty average with the 2 GB I was able to only run 4-5 apps in the background. The Moto g4 play runs on the android 6.0 marshmallow with the stock android UI on top of it, the UI is very nice it doesn't have much bloat ware right out of the box. I personally love the stock android looks, but many people don't like it much.CAMERAThe 8mp rear camera is pretty average, under natural lighting, the dynamic range is okay, with decent colour reproduction but sometimes the exposure compensation doesn't work that good, the low light performance is pretty bad, there is a lot of noise in the images. The camera does shoot videos in 1080p resolution but again the video quality is pretty average. The front facing 5mp camera is okay the images looks a bit over saturated for me but it is nice not great.BATTERYThe 2800 MAH battery is pretty average as well, you may get a day of battery life on moderate usage. But it is not good for heavy users or gamers. The g4 play does support fast charging and comes with the turbo charger, it takes around 2.5 or 3 hours to get fully charge.THE PROS1. DECENT BUILT2. DUAL SIM WITH 4G VoLTE SUPPORT3. MICRO SD CARD SLOT4. GOOD FOR DAY TO DAY MODERATE USAGE5. DECENT DISPLAY6. DECENT SPEAKERTHE CONS1. AVERAGE CAMERA2. AVERAGE BATTERY LIFE3. NOT GOOD FOR MULTITASKING OR INTENSE GAMING4. NO FINGERPRINT SCANNER5. NO GYROSCOPE MEANS NO VR SUPPORTTHE MOTO G4 PLAY IS A PRETTY AVERAGE SMART PHONE WITH AVERAGE SPECS, IT IS ONLY GOOD FOR MODERATE USERS AND THOSE WHO LOVE STOCK ANDROID EXPERIENCE, FOR PERFORMANCE WISE THE REDMI NOTE 3 PERFORMS BETTER IN PROCESSING, CAMERA, AND BATTERY PERFORMANCE. BUT YOU HAVE TO SPEND SOMEWHAT MORE MONEY……"

 [5] "I bought this on September 10. Since October 17, the battery inadvertently gets heated up. This has no set pattern. Sometimes while charging sometimes while using the phone. No particular pattern. I am no gamer, so it heats up in normal usage. Writing to Lenovo customer care, directed me to Motorola Customer care. This is what they have to say:Uninstall one by one application and check with the device performance.1. Reduce the brightness to Auto or lower down the brightness levels under Settings--Display-Brightness2. Reduce the sleep timeout- under Settings--Display-Sleep-Set it to 30 sec3. Disable live wallpaper ( if any) under Settings--Display-Wallpaper4. Close all the background applications. Educate customers to close all recent applications properly.5. Turn off Wi-Fi when not required,Using camera for extended period of time leads the device to heat.6. Turn off 3G when not required7. Turn off Bluetooth when not requiredEven after following this if the device exceeds please do a factory reset. Basically don't use the phone.Samsung at one point of time wanted the Note users to charge their battery only up to 60%. Avoided Samsung to get stuck with the same issue.Anyone else facing the same issue? It  worked very well for 45 days and then the battery started heating up. Has anyone faced a similar issue?
