 [4] "The Moto G4 Play and Moto E3 Power are currently the best offerings by the Lenovo owned Motorola. If you're not really a fan of Chinese deviceslike Redmi, Coolpad, Meizu or OnePlus, Motorola devices have really proven themselves to be quite long lasting companions.Now, within the budget segment of 10K, we've these 2 phones and without much delay I would like to review how both these phones fair against each other.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Build Quality:->-----------------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play look quite similar to each other. Both feature a plastic body with a sort of textured finish. But the E3 Power houses a separate speaker grill at the bottom bezels while the G4 Play has a mono grill at the top for the earpiece and speaker. The sound output is better on E3 Power due to the extra grill.The back of E3 Power lacks a textured finish while the G4 Play has a texture design on back, making it easy to hold in hand.Screen & Display:->------------------------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play feature a 5\" inch 720 x 1280 pixels 294 ppi pixel density display. It's fairly bright and offers great contrast thanks to the low black levels. Sunlight legibility is also good.Both the phones have Corning Gorilla Glass 3 Protection and Nano Coating which makes them splash proof or accidental water spillings.While the Moto G4 Play has Moto Display and One Handed Mode, the E3 Power doesn't have them.Performance:->-----------------------The E3 Power runs on a MediaTek 6735P QuadCore CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1GHz and a Mali-T720 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 1.1GB to be free. Switching between apps and multi-tasking is fluid. The phone has noticeable lags on heavy usage. The device performs poorly on heavy gaming, although midrange games like Subway Surfers run well without any issues. No heating issues as well.The G4 Play runs on a Snapdragon 410 Quad Core CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1.2GHz and a Adreno 306 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 900 MB to be free. Ram management seems poor on G4 Play as compared to E3 Power as the usage seems to be more. But surprisingly the device fares better to E3 Power in terms of multi-tasking and Gaming due to a powerful CPU. Asphalt 8 runs smoothly without any issue. The device heats upto 38.C to 40.C which isn't always an issue.Storage:->---------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play come with 16GB of Internal Storage. You get upto 11GB free on E3 Power while around 10.5GB on the G4 Play. Both the phones support USB OTG.Expandable Storage:E3 Power: 32GB via MicroSD CardG4 Play: 128GB via MicroSD CardCamera:->----------------Both the E3 Power and G4 Play house a 8MP Rear and 5MP Front facing Camera. The performance is above average in daylight and proper lighting conditions. The Camera performs average in night and low light. The flash is really helpful in low light. The device runs Moto's Stock Camera app with a Shutter button. You can use the exposure mode, Panoroma, HDR or Video Modes. While the E3 Power can only record 720p videos, G4 Play can record upto 1080p videos. The Camera focusing on E3 Power is better than that of G4 Play, so is the post image processing but the shutter speed is better in G4 Play.The Selfie Camera will really delight you. You can always use a 3rd Party filter app on the both these devices to take some neat selfies.Battery:->---------------While the E3 Power comes with a 3600maH battery, the G4 Play comes with a 2800maH battery. The battery on E3 Power is nothing short to incredible and easily lasts for a day with moderate usage. and last over 1.5 days but with heavy usage lasts only upto 9 to 10 hours.. You can get screen on-time of 8 to 9 hours easily. The rapid charger bundled with the phone takes 3.5 hours to 4 hours to fully charge the device.The G4 Play lasts upto a day with moderate usage but with heavy usage lasts only upto 7 to 8 hours. The G4 Play also comes with the rapid charger and the charging takes around 3 hours.Both the phones feature a removable battery.4G Network & Jio:->-------------------------------Both Moto E3 Power and G4 Play support VoLTE (Band 40) and can be used with a Reliance Jio Sim Welcome Offer. Yes, you can dial numbers from Stock Dialer without connecting to Mobile Data. Bear in mind that the phones reach upto a temperature of 40.C when continuously on 4G.Battery Life on 4G:->-------------------------------With continuous 4G usage, the E3 Power can last for 6 to 7 hours while the G4 Play lasts upto 5 hours.Software & OS:->--------------------------Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play run of Stock Android version of Android 6.0 Marshmallow with Minor Tweaks by Motorola. Although the E3 Power is a month old, it won't get the Android Nougat 7.0 update which is a huge disappointment for budget users, while the G4 Play with 14 other devices will get Android 7.0 Nougat Update.Conclusion->--------------------The E3 Power proves to be the obvious choice if you want a device that performs better on battery life as well as the Camera. The E3 Power is available every Monday via Flash sales on Flipkart for Rs 7999.The G4 Play although has a smaller battery is a better performer with the powerful CPU and higher capacity for storage via MicroSD Card. The G4 Play will also get the Nougat Update.If you're not into heavy usage and Android Updates, the E3 Power should be your choice."

 [9] "DesignThe Moto G4 Play has a thin frame at 9.9mm and the weight is 4.83 ounces (0.31 pounds). At the top-front of the G4 Play is a front-facing speaker. And at the bottom is the micro USB charger port. The 3.5mm headphone jack is at the top of the G4 Play.On the back of the G4 Play is a plastic cover and it can be peeled from the bottom. The edges of the G4 Play are rounded, making it easier to grip in the palm of your hand. The Moto G4 is available in two colors: black and white.What features seem to be missing from the G4 Play? The G4 Play does not have a fingerprint sensor like the G4 Plus does. And the G4 Play is not as durable as devices like the Galaxy S7 and the iPhone 7 because it does not come with an IP rating. And it does not have near field communications (NFC). However, the G4 Play does have water repellent nano-coating so it is protected from splashes and rain."  [2] "First of all I don’t understand why Motorola is not launching all their G4 variants at once in India. I mean why one by one when all of them are at different price tag. Now lets move on to the topic of the post which is about the Moto G4 Play (4th Generation) pros and cons. However do note that the review points which I have mentioned below are based on facts rather than my personal taste. Reasons to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Pros):1. The display resolution is only a HD panel but because of the smaller 5 inch size the pixel density is higher than a 5.5 inch. Color representation, saturation and brightness are evenly balanced with good viewing angles.2. Its processor is powered by a 1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 chipset which is kind of decent.3. Along with that it comes with a primary memory of 2 GB. Now compared to its counterparts its more than enough as Moto devices are completely bloatware free.4. Next Moto G4 Play pros is that for gaming the graphics is powered by Adreno 306 which runs many of the high end games smoothly.5. Consumers buy Motorola smartphones primarily for their clean software. And yes this one is absolutely clean which is almost stock Android. The version of the Marshmallow 6.0.1 which is currently the latest one.6. While many smartphones are ditching their memory card slot, this smartphone has a got dedicated one. It can be expanded up to 128 GB with the help of a microSD card.7. Another Moto G4 Play pros is the nano coating over the smartphone display provides water repellent feature. (But remember that this is not water resistant).8. The battery capacity is of 2800 mAh which is enough for a 5 inch screen smartphone to last throughout the day even for an avid user.9. For the protection of the display it comes with a Corning Gorilla 3.10. And yes it has a fast battery charging technology, not Quick Charge though but with a 10 watt rapid charger.Reasons Not to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Cons):1. The first is the quality of both the 8 megapixel primary camera and 5 megapixel secondary camera is not good in low light condition. The LED flash helps a little but not much to remove grains. The reason is because of the smaller f/2.2 focal aperture.2. Next Moto G4 Play cons is that despite being a small 5 inch smartphone it still feels bulky due to the thickness of 9.9 mm. This is too thick in today’s standard.3. At the current price tag there are dozens of smartphones that does comes with a fingerprint sensor, but this one ain’t got one.4. Another Moto G Play 4th Gen cons is that there is no dedicated navigational touch buttons below the screen. The screen is already a small one and the navigation’s are all placed on the screen itself.5. And finally the last Moto G Play (4th Gen) cons is that there is no gyroscope sensor."

 [7] "The Moto g4 play Android smartphone is awesome. I am using Jio in the Android smartphone. Working well. The VoLTE feature help me to call directly, without using any other apps. Good for playing high speed and graphics oriented games such asphalt extreme, mortal Kombat, need for speed no limits etc. The Camera quality of the Android smartphone is awesome. There is a feature called exposure control by which you can control the amount of light exposure. The phone really very fast. Disadvantage is that there is a hole on the back side of the phone, the purpose of which is unknown. Also the microphone hole in the front side of the phone is unexpected as most of modern day Android smartphone hides the microphone hole. Sound quality is very good.Battery standby time is good. If you use the phone continue, with wifi or with Mobile Data, roughly 10 to 15 hours, the battery will last for 24 to 30 hours. The charger is a super fast charger. If you charge the Mobile with 10 percent battery then within 1 hour and 10 minutes the battery will be fully charged. Front camera is very good. Face detection feature is present in the phone. There is a feature of barcode scanner and QR code scanner inbuilt in the Camera. If take a photo of any product with barcode, QR code then the inbuilt scanner will scan the code immediately.I am very satisfied with the phone. The battery is also removable, which is not present in older Moto phones.Roughly 10 GB of internal memory is available for use."

 [6] "Before i start let me tell you that i really hate brands like Xiaomi, Coolpad, Oppo etc.Not that there is anything wrong with them, it's just a matter of personal opinion.In comparison with the Redmi 3S prime and similary priced phones , the G4 play is on the lower end of the specs sheet.But that certainly does not mean it is less efficient or productive in any way.As a matter of fact, the stock Android and brilliant optimisation makes up for it.I have been using this phone for over a month now and these are the pros and cons :Pros:1.Amazing battery life.on paper 2800 mAH might not seem to be big, but the screen size, resolution and software tweaks/doze mode increases the battery life to a very good extent.2.The screen is pretty good for this price range.The viewing angles are good, colour reproduction is good and the 293 ppi is apt for a 5 inch screen.(1080p would have drained battery faster, been more tasking on the processor and is really an overkill for a 5 inch display)3.Camera: This is one of the best camera I've seen in a phone in the below 10K price range.The daylight photos are amazing.But the night-time photos are a bit grainy, but that can be fixed with filters and a bit editing.The front Camera too does not fail to impress.4.Software updates is the main reason i chose this phone over the e3 power as this will be getting the Nougat 7.0 update in December.5.Fast charging : This goes from 10-60 in about 30mins , and it takes another 45 mins to reach 100.Most of us really need only  60% for everyday use, so that shouldn't be a problem.Also Doze mode is very good at minimising power usage while the phone is not in use.Heavy users can charge it early in the morning in case they need the 100%.Cons:1.The processor: the Adreno 410 is a famous processor , well known for being in almost all budget phones since 2013 ,But this is 2016 . The processor is a bit outdated and the gpu can handle most games expect for very intensive games like Nova 3.But come on, for 8999 you can't expect to see an Adreno 617 or an 800 :).Yet again people might say similarly priced Redmi 3S prime has better specs, but guess what, their UI is crap and their hardware isn't well optimised.At the end of the day, it is your opinion, playing a bit intensive game, or having a smooth experience.Don't get me wrong here, apart from stuttering while running intensive games, there is nothing else it complain about it.Normal to medium- heavy ish games run real fine and daily usage/multitasking happens without a hiccup.2.Heating is an unavoidable factor but i still wished they looked into this a little.The phone heats when playing continuously or while charging (Fast charger, duh!)3.Bezel: I just wish that the screen to body ratio would have  been increased a little bit in this as the bottom looks a bit bare without the fingerprint.4.No fingerprint sensor: Yes , most phones in this  range have one, but the price is low so i think it is justified.5.No gyroscope: for people who don't need this, this should been be a problem, but some moto actions like chop twice for flashlight and some games might need it.Note that Pokémon go requires a gyroscope for AR, but if it's turned off, the app will work just fine.Extra Points:The moto G4 Play gets extra marks for making the battery removable and for incorporting the moto display feature into this.It also is splash resistant, not waterproof.( Isn't a major issue, even it's big brother the G4 plus and the 35K moto Z lack waterproofing)Also for clarification, even though its not mentioned anywhere, just like the moto G4 and G4 plus , the G4 play also has Gorilla Glass 3.Verdict: For Medium - heavy users on a tight budget, or as a secondary phone or as a temporary replacement,the Moto G4 Play is the best phone in the market right now.My Rating : 8.9/10"

 [1] "Motorola Moto G4 Play smartphone was launched in May 2016. The phone comes with a 5.00-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 720 pixels by 1280 pixels at a PPI of 294 pixels per inch.The Motorola Moto G4 Play is powered by 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor and it comes with 2GB of RAM. The phone packs 16GB of internal storage that can be expanded up to 128GB via a microSD card. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Motorola Moto G4 Play packs a 8-megapixel primary camera on the rear and a 5-megapixel front shooter for selfies.The Motorola Moto G4 Play runs Android 6.0.1 and is powered by a 2800mAh non removable battery. It measures 144.40 x 72.00 x 9.90 (height x width x thickness) and weighs 137.00 grams.The Motorola Moto G4 Play is a dual SIM (GSM and GSM) smartphone that accepts two Micro-SIM. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, GPS, Bluetooth, FM, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India). Sensors on the phone include Proximity sensor, Ambient light sensor, Accelerometer, and Gyroscope."

[10] "Great phone with all the features you need for daily tasksWriting a brief review after 10 days of usage.-Main reason i like it is the clutter free stock android marshmallow (planned upgrade to nougat)-Decent processor with 2gb ram sufficient for daily tasks without any lag and snappy performance-16gb internal memory expandable to 128gb through sd card.-Crisp 5 inch 720p display-Nice camera good enough for average users.Photogaraphy enthusiasts should go for a better camera but this one gets the job done.-Not meant for heavy games but still manages to play some heavy demanding games.-Dual sim 4g volte-Removable battery, good battery life lasts approx a day and even more with moderate usage.Nice 10 watt rapid charger.-Good build quality. Feels light but solid in hand.-Water repellent nano coating but not water resistant like moto g3.-Normal heating while charging,watching videos for prolonged times,games.Cons- Not really cons but i wish it had the following features--It does not have gyroscope but it hardly matters coz we dont need it for daily practical uses.-It does not have  moto gestures like karate chop for flashlight but it has features like double press the power button to turn on camera and facial recognition to unlock the phone.Overall a good smartphone with all the features you will ever need for daily practical usesThere are other phones in same price range with much better specs but if u want a simple clutter free snappy stock android experience, Moto G4 Play is the best option I think in this price range. Heavy gamers should look for better specs."

 [7] "Advantages of Motorola Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Merits or Pros):1. The resolution may not be full HD but the color accuracy, contrast, saturation and brightness are quite evenly balanced.2. The 1.2 GHz Quad-core Snapdragon 410 chipset for processing runs the smartphone without any issues.3. The primary memory is of 2 GB for multitasking.4. Another Motorola Moto G4 Play, 4th Gen advantages is the Adreno 306 GPU is for graphics.5. Latest version of Android Marshmallow v6.0.1 for the operating system and of course without any bloatwares.6. It has got a dedicated memory card slot which can be expanded up to 128 GB with the help of a microSD card.7. Next Moto G Play, 4th Gen is the nano coating on the display which provides a water repellent feature.8. The 2800 mAh battery capacity is enough to last more than a day, provided its battery saving mode is active.9. There is a Corning Gorilla Glass 3 for protection for the display.10. Not Quick Charge but it has a way for fast battery charging with a 10 watt rapid charger which is supplied with the box.1. First is that because of the smaller f/2.2 focal aperture of both the primary and secondary camera the quality in low light condition and artificial lightning are not good. Outdoor images are quite good however.2. Many smartphones are now well below the thickness of 8 mm, but the Moto G Play, 4th Gen is of 9.9 mm which is close to 10 mm.3. Next Moto G4 Play, 4th Gen disadvantages or cons is that it does not have a fingerprint sensor. I am asking for it as there are smartphones that does comes with a fingerprint sensor at this price tag.4. All the navigational touch buttons are placed on the screen itself, its already a small screen smartphone.5. And the last Motorola Moto G Play (4th Gen) cons or demerits is the absence of a gyroscope sensor."

 [1] "Hello guys i am using this phone from 4 month.As you all know that we all think 100 times befor e investing our hard earned money. This review can be a bit lengthy but read it fully as I explain everything.Specs: 5-inch HD display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 | 1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 quad-core processor | 2GB RAM + 16GB internal memory (expandable up to 128GB) | 8MP rear camera | 5MP front camera | 2,800 mAh batteryWhat’s good?Moto G4 Play has a great design and is easy to hold. It gets a textured plastic back and silver metal rims. The smartphone has rounded edges, and Moto branding is placed neatly at the rear. Moto G4 Play looks elegant, even though it doesn’t have a metal unibody design. Make sure you buy a back cover if you pick the white colour variant as it tends to get dirty. Plus, you won’t have to worry about accidentally spilling liquids on the phone, thanks to its water-repellent coating.Moto G4 Play has a great design and is easy to hold. It gets textured plastic back and silver metal rims.The display is vivid and sharp. However, it doesn’t make for good viewing angles in bright outdoors. I had to struggle with the display in sunlight.Moto G4 Play has a great battery life. Even though there’s 2,8000 mAh battery on paper, the battery optimisation is great. Moto G4 Play will easily last for a little more than a day from moderate to heavy usage.  Plus, it doesn’t take too much of a time to get charged.The rear camera performs decent in places where there’s ample light. The performance is at par with a lot of devices that I’ve reviewed in the same price segment. But the low-light results are grainy and pictures tend to have a lot of noise. The front camera clicks fairly good pictures.Performance isn’t an issue while multitasking and transition between tabs is swift. I mainly used it for watching YouTube videos, browsing Facebook, messaging on WhatsApp etc; and G4 Play didn’t give me a reason to complain. However, playing even the most basic games for a long duration makes the device slow. So much so that after a while you’ll find yourself playing a slow motion of CandyCrush, which you’d want to quit very soon.What’s bad?There’s nothing really wrong with the device, expect the missing fingerprint scanner and lack of full HD display. The budget segment is full of devices that offer some really good specifications at low price point, which has raised the bar.Moto G4 Play, Moto G4 Play review, Lenovo, Moto, Moto G4 Play price, Moto G4 Play features, Moto G4 Play features, Moto G4, Moto G4 Plus, budget smartphones, Android, smartphones, technology, technology newsMoto G4 Play is a decent budget smartphone that will please most buyers.VerdictMoto G4 Play is a decent budget smartphone that will please most buyers. If fingerprint scanner is not your priority in a smartphone, then go for the G4 Play. Remember, the device does lag in terms of performance, especially during gaming. Competitions to consider in the segment include – Xiaomi 3s Prime, slightly higher Redmi Note 3, LeEco Le 1s, and Lenovo K5 Note.PLEASE HIT THE HELPFUL VOTE YOUR HELPFUL VOTE HELPS A LOT"

 [7] "Motorola launched this device a few days back and it is mainly aimed at people who love to enjoy entertainment on their handheld device.The phone features some incredible features and some drawbacks. Let us talk about the various aspects of this device.DISPLAY:5in display is just the perfect size in my opinion. 720p HD is decent for viewing videos but is not adequate for immersive gaming experience. During the review, the colors produced decent and the viewing angles were not that great. Gorilla glass 3 provides additional security as I survived a couple of drops from 3-4 feet without damaging the screen.BATTERY:Motorola claims that this battery lasts for a day with moderate usage but that is not the case. I usually end up charging this phone thrice a day with moderate-heavy usage with about 30 mins of gaming. The charging is quite fast as compared to its competitors. The phone did heat up a bit while charging.SOFTWARE:Motorola is one of those companies which are still producing devices with almost no bloat. The company has tried to provide users with a stock android experience in this device. The device has voLTE compability and worked well with my JIO 4G sim during the test period.INTERNAL:The phone is powered by a snapdragon 410 processor which is quite old. 2GB of RAM is not adequate as I found lagging issues on this device. The phone cannot even handle 15 light apps running in the background.CAMERA:Low- light performance is not that great. The photos are of decent quality and the HDR mode works just fine. Motorola need to work on its software department as the camera app needs to refined.Verdict: The phone feels quiet cheap in the hand with its plastic build. The buttons are clicky and provide a nice feedback. The speakers are average and the display is a bit outdated. But considering the price of this device, It has a lot of positives including water resistance and fast charging. I would highly consider other competitors such as coolpad note 3 plus and Le 1s eco,Le2. The phone is a good buy for people who wish to have a nice and affordable smartphone for light use."

 [8] "INTRODUCTION:xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxVery recently, I was presented this opportunity to choose a mobile for my friend who can’t help himself but to forget or drop his mobile phone in a repeated fashion. His previous Nokia windows mobile kept going for long but finally succumbed to his handling manners. LOL.Thus, I was put up in a situation to find a good economically viable & VFM mobile as most of us would like to have, but before we proceed with the review ,Its always important to set our priorities straight as the final purchase process would be a way full of distractions & not just a straightforward plunge.Let’s check if my requirements are aligned to any of you as well.PRIORITIES & EXPECTATIONS FROM THE PRODUCT :xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx1.) PRIMARY USAGE :a.) Regular Priorities : Internet surfing , Video watching, VoLTE capable & a decent Camera.b.) Occasional Priorities : Sparse gaming & music on loudspeakers.2.) HANDLING AND CARE : Rough to negligent. Might be used for videos & games by kindergarten kids.3.) BUDGET : Entry level and below 10000.Must never hurt to break or lose the mobile.4.) SOCIAL STATURE : Must be well preserved with a reputed Brand name.5.) LOOKS : Must be sleek & slip resistant to hold. Must fit any shirt or jeans pocket.6.) OS & HARDWARE :a.) Bloatware free stock Android 6 or more.2 GB RAM with not less than 16 GB internal expandable microSD card.b.) Must be Dual SIM with 4G and VoLTE.c.) Good viewing angles and contrast ratio with a super responsive touchscreen.d.) Decent Autofocussing camera with LED flash & high shutter speeds.e.) Not less than 5.0 inches with HD resolutionf.) A reputed trusted brand with easy availability of service centres.g.) Decent one day Battery backup with preference to removable battery & rapid charging.h.) Slip resistant to hold, Solid loudspeakers & Decent legibility under sun.i.) Last but not the least, must be extremely rugged with corning gorilla glass protection.Now, Lets examine the Merits & De-Merits of contenders one by one:1.) SAMSUNG ON5/ON7 PRO : ( * Never Buy TFT’s )xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxPros:a.) Decent price tag of around 8000 bucks.b.) Grand Brand name & reliability of Samsung.c.) HD 720p resolution,Reputed camera & Decent Quadcore 1.3 GHz CPU & Mali T720 GPU.Cons :a.) A basic TFT display which is by no means worthy to look at.b.) No mention of any display protection like dragon tail or gorilla glass.c.) 8 GB internal memory with 1.5 GB RAM not re-assuring by any means for future upgrades.The cons with TFT screen (even for ON7),no display protection and 8 GB/1.5 GB internal memory/RAM were a big NO,so ruled out of contention.2.) Samsung J2 Pro 2016 : ( A serious Contender with S.AMOLED Display )xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxPros:a.) A 5.0 “superAmoled screen was a big plus.b.) 1.5 GHz quad core CPU with turbo speed technology to load apps faster.c.) Decent price tag of around 9000 bucks.d.) Android marshmallow & Decent low light snaps.Cons:a.) Smart glow and back cover design and plastic not upto my taste (personal preference).Overall Seems delicate to my usage.b.) No fast battery charging options.c.) Low loud speaker output.Me and my friend did not like a bit fragile & odd back design of this as a personal preference ,though On specs I would surely recommend this over any Xiaomi or entry level mobile.A sAMOLED display beats any IPS /TFT display at any given time and also conserves battery.3.) Xiaomi Redmi 3s/3s prime : ( Looks better on Specs & features but…)xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxIts Xiaomi's raining everywhere but Xiaomi’s are a bit tricky.Its phone specs may look good on paper with phenomenal 3 GB RAM and 32 GB internal memory but its memory management is not as efficient as bloatfree OS of MOTO G4 play and webpages,games & app load anytime faster on Moto’s than on the Xiaomi 3S/Primes.On Bootup/shutdown times ,games & photo editing it MOTO G4 might suffer a bit though due to lower CPU and ram configurations.Pros:a.) Higher CPU & GPU configurations.32 GB/3GB Ram vs 16 GB/2GB ram on Moto G4 play.b.) All metal build though the buttons are of plastic in contrast to metal ones on Moto G4 play.c.) Better HDR dynamic range.Selfies are wide angle with better contrast ratios.d.) Equipped with fingerprint scannerfor better security and IR blaster for any TV or AC remote functions.Gyroscope missing on G4 play.e.) Fast battery charging as in moto G4 play.Cons:a.) Both G4 play and redmi produce oversaturated colors though G4 play mostly captures with warmer color tones.b.) The metal shine wears off in a month or two from the redmi 3S primes.c.) Inferior RAM management & bloatware cluttered MIUI OS causing lag in loading of apps games and webpages. So if the primary use is just surfing or apps ,Moto G4 play is better.d.) Touch seems to be much responsive on Moto G4 play than Redmi.e.) Service center penetration of Lenovo Motorola far superior to Xiaomi.MOTO G4 PLAY FEATURES :xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx1.) A decent rugged build entry level mobile phone .A metal rim on circumference to take any impact. Corning Gorilla glass 3 protection on display with a water repellant nano coating for protection against minor liquid spillages.2.) Most amazing 10 W charger adaptor where with 15 minutes you can get 5 hours backup. charges at 5.2 V DC with 2.0 Amps of current. Charger has a USB port where a dual data/power cable could be connected.3.) OTG enabled usb port & super responsive 5.0”HD IPS wide angle display with 294 PPI . clutter free Android 6(Marshmallow) OS updateable to Android 7 (Nougat) ,loads apps, games, webpages super fast.4.) Dual SIM 4G & VoLTE support on both SIMs.5.) 9.9 mm Thin profile with textured anti-slip back and 137 gms in weight.6.) Lighter Li-Po 2800 mAh battery with easy 1 days backup.7.) Decent 8MP autofocussing f/2.2 primary camera with LED flash & fast shutter speeds .manual exposure control on the Fly is additional advantage. Pics may get overexposed at times and low light snaps may not be the best but again clarity is good.8.) Sun legibility is quite OK but not as good as on other Xiaomi or J2 pro 2016.9.) No gyroscope, fingerprint sensor or IR blaster to add to the feature richness.10.) A Quadcore 1.2 GHz CPU with 2 GB ram against octacores /3 GB RAMs in Xiaomis .Its effect though hardly noticeable in routine operations except Bootup/Shutdown times, High end gamings or any other CPU/GPU intensive jobs like Photo editing.11.) Front situated Loudspeakers superb Loud and clear unlike rear placed on Xiaomi mobiles.12.) Service center penetration better to Xiaomi’s but inferior to Samsung.OVERALL VERDICT FOR MOTO G4 PLAY :xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxFor those looking for a cheap and best reputed branded, rugged good VFM mobile with Rapid charging, Decent camera with good clarity, Loud and clear Loudspeakers ,HD IPS wide angle, super responsive display and blazing fast loading of apps & webpages, Moto G4 play is the best choice.Its an entry level mobile so do not expect Flagship model performances.Its quite good for all basic functions with decent hardwares.It meets serious competition from the SuperAMOLED equipped Samsung J2 pro 2016 and feature rich Xiaomi Redmi mobiles at a little extra cost.However, at the end of the day, It’s a matter of personal preference ,usage & expenditure since we all know there’s always something better to buy with an extra money.***You may like to go for better feature laden Moto G4 plus for a little extra***xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxFYI, I myself own a 64 GB Samsung S6 edge which was more than 6 times the Moto G4 play’s cost but if you ask me in terms of VFM today ,I don’t see the superiority of S6 over G4 or for instance MOTO G4 plus  in the same proportion. So finally its your wise decision to make based upon your priorities."

 [6] "I bought this phone on 6th sep and received it on 8th Sep 2016.Packing: Packing was really bad, but delivery was quick.Built: Phone's built is not very impressive, Slightly thicker body. The back cover is really low quality. It feels like it will melt during summer due to heat. The button shows good amount of feedback that is a good thing. Corning gorilla glass, water repellent coating make it reliable.Camera: Rear camera (8 mp LED Flash) and Front Camera (5 mp) shows very good color reproduction in low light as well as artificial lights. Negative point is that the front camera doesn't have led flash. There are editing and beautification options too. There is a secondary mic for noise cancellation.Display: 720 p hd display with CG glass. Short cut option for one handed operation available. Good viewing angles, edges are smooth and sharp. Sun readability not upto the mark.Processer : Snapdragon 410 processor at a price point of 8999 ' can be said BETTER because if we would have had 615 octa core processor it could have caused heating issues. Therefore, given processor can be said better at this price point for this phone.Android versions: Marshmallows 6.0 good system with no bloat wares is exceptionally great thing about this phone.File manager: A file manager app is given instead of a gallery. Not very impressive!In short, the gallery is summarised in file manager so that we are able to access photos, videos, word, PDF, zip files. It is good thing to get all things at one place.Sound: Sound quality is better not best with speaker as well as headphones given. You need to buy best quality head phones which is already mentioned in the offers for buyersUI: stock android UI is lag free , but RAM management is not as good as compared to Redmi 3s prime. If you open up 10-15 apps simultaneously, while switching to the first open app it starts to reload....Gaming: gaming is average, some frames drops at times while playing hd games. If you are a Gamer consider buying high end phones Better GPU with all sensors like gyro, compass and ram over 4 gb with 820 snapdragon processor.Continued....Jio sim review:I found calls being made very easily with Jio 4g sim. No need to install any voice calling app. Data connectivity is also good not better since Jio speed reduces. Calls quality is better with Jio. But other operators does not provide sufficient POI (point of interconnect) to Jio . This has been the major problem. Also to let you know that Jio calls are made through data connections it further deteriorates the situation considering the fact that other operators are not provide support to Jio.To conclude, I would say that calls are better not best using Jio. Internet quality from Jio would be rated as 3½ stars"

 [1] "the moto g4 play is the budget option from Motorola in the 4th gen moto g series, as being under 10,000 rs is it better than its competitors? let's find out.-------------------------------------------WHATS IN THE BOX-===================1. THE G4 PLAY ITSELF2. USB CABLE3. TURBO CHARGER4. BASIC EARPHONES5. MANUALS AND WARRENTY GUIDE.------------------------------------------THE DESIGN AND SCREEN-=========================The moto g4 play has a full plastic built, it doesn't feel great like the Redmi note 3 in hand. the back and the battery are removable where you will also find the micro sd card slot and dual 4g sim card slot, it supports VoLTE my jio network worked on it just fine. the g4 play is only 137 gm so it feels very light while holding. the g4 play doesn't have the finger print scanner. the only speaker that the g4 play have is the earpiece, it works pretty well for both calls and media consumption. the 5 inch display is decent, it's only 720p but colors looks decent and vibrant, with decent amount of brightness, but the viewing angles are not that great the colors gets washed out in some angles. the display is not better than the Redmi note 3 or the coolpad note 5,but it gets the job done.-------------------------------------------------THE PERFORMENCE-===================the moto g4 play has the snapdragon 410 processor with the adreno 306 gpu and 2 gb of ram, the processor works great for day to day usage and casual gaming, it also handles heavy usage pretty well but the gaming performance is not that good, there is a lot of lagging in heavy games. the multitasking of this phone was pretty average with the 2 gb I was able to only run 4-5 apps in the background. the moto g4 play runs on the android 6.0 marshmallow with the stock android UI on top of it, the UI is very nice it doesn't have much bloatware right out of the box. I personally love the stock android looks, but many people don't like it much.-------------------------------------------THE CAMERA-=============the 8mp rear camera is pretty average, under natural lighting, the dynamic range is okay, with decent color reproduction but sometimes the exposure compensation doesn't work that good, the low light performance is pretty bad, there is a lot of noise in the images. the camera does shoot videos in 1080p resolution but again the video quality is pretty average.the front facing 5mp camera is okay the images looks a bit over saturated for me but it is nice not great.------------------------------------------THE BATTERY-================the 2800 mah battery is pretty average as well, you may get a day of battery life on moderate usage. but it is not good for heavy users or gamers. the g4 play does support fast charging and comes with the turbo charger, it takes around  2.5 or 3 hours to get fully charge.-------------------------------------------THE PROS-===========1. DECENT BUILT2. DUAL SIM WITH 4G VoLTE SUPPORT3. MICRO SD CARD SLOT4. GOOD FOR DAY TO DAY MODERATE USAGE5.  DECENT DISPLAY6. DECENT SPEAKER-THE CONS-===========1. AVERAGE CAMERA2. AVERAGE BATTERY LIFE3. NOT GOOD FOR MULTITASKING OR INTENSE GAMING4. NO FINGERPRINT SCANNER5. NO GYROSCOPE MEANS NO VR SUPPORT----------------------------------------FINAL VERDICT- the moto g4 play is a pretty average smartphone with average specs, it is only good for moderate users and those who love stock android experience, for performance wise the Redmi note 3 performs better in processing, camera, and battery performance.----------------------------------------IF YOU LIKE MY REVIEW PLEASE SUPPORT BY CLICKING ON THAT HELPFUL BUTTON, IT MEANS  ALOT.-----------------------------------------THANK YOU"
 [2] "Bought this for Rs7999(+Rs750 cashback so basically for Rs7250). And this might be the best phone in the price segment.Pros-1. Stock Android Experience without any bloatwares with OS 6.0.1( might get 7.0 update). Volte supported.2. Both the cameras are very good considering the price. Front facing camera does very good job in natural light. Even rear facing camera is better than other phones like Lenovo (parent company!), Xiaome. It does Pretty good job in natural light.Cameras interface is easy and user friendly.Easy access to the exposure setting that helps take good pictures in low light and over exposed sun light.3. Though it is fully made up of plastic, the build quality seems good. plastic makes it weigh light . It has Gorilla Glass v3 protection. Check out some YouTube videos regarding build quality.4. It has nano coating that protects phone from accidental splashes, direct rainfalls on the screen. (However most of the smartphones can resist the splashes)5. Screen quality is pretty good (294ppi)6.MOTO sensors.7. Excellent sound output. More than I expected. I have lenovo phone with dolby speakers(claimed!) But moto has a far better sound output.7. After sell services by Lenovo- Motorola is excellent. They have their authorized service centers in almost all cities.8. Rapid charger (2amp, 5.2V, 10w output ) charges the phone pretty fast. However it is not a very fast or a quick charger.9. Battery backup is good. On 4g network and usual day-to-day usage it will last a day for sure.Cons-1.For the regular price of Rs8999 it should have 32gb of storage but it has 16gb storage, user storage is 11gb. 2gb of ram is enough for the normal user.2. No gyroscope sensor - If you are thinking to enjoy VR at such low price , forget it.3.Screen to body ratio is too less. Bezels are too broad and hence make the device unnecessarily broad. It is bit thicker.4. Cameras in artificial light or low light isn't good.5. Processors given is sd410, phone lags when played( in MX player )full HD videos. Might depend upon player app used.All the con's are totally negligible .Conclusion- Battery could have been better.Processor is not made for heavy users. Normal users will not be affected. I got this phone for Rs7999 so it was good deal for me. If it costed me Rs8999 i wouldn't have given 5star.if you are planning to buy it for Rs8999 , I would suggest you add some extra bucks to your budget and look at other moto phones like moto g4 plus. Or wait for the price drop.Cons are totally negligible.Overall specifications justify the price. And if you are a normal user then you should sure go for it.Hit the helpful button."

 [8] "I bought this phone around 6 months ago during the Diwali period and got a good offer. Very happy with the phone in terms of -  performance - snappy and no lag despite installing 40 - 50  Apps and putting 12- 15  GB of data for photos, music files. Performs the same after the V7 Nougat update. - battery lasts a day at the most with moderate usage. - turbo charger charges the phone fast - 10 - 15 mins gives it 30-50 % charge and 1 to 1.5 hours for a full charge depending on how much power the batter had. It took a bit of time to figure out how to get it working initially though as it kept saying slow charging on the screen though I was using the turbo charger. - camera is quite good, not that great in low light. - almost stock Android with no skins, bloatware etc, easy to use and you get OS updates quite fast as Google releases newer versions - perhaps the best part if this is important to you. - fingerprint scanner makes locking / unlocking the phone a breeze."

 [5] "DesignPro: The Moto G4 is lightweight and packed with solid hardware.Con: Missing features like NFC are kind of a bummer.DisplayPro: By making the display smaller in the G4 Play, it makes the device easier to grip.Con: Unfortunately, the display has a lower resolution — which makes it less sharp than the other G4 devicesUser InterfacePro: The lack of clutter in the operating system makes the G4 Play much more intuitive than other Android devices.Con: The lack of bells and whistles makes it less appealing to consumers that want higher end smartphones. For example, you won’t be able to record in 4K using the G4 Play nor does it have a fingerprint sensor.ProcessorPro: The Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor is sufficient for handling productive tasks using the G4 Play.Con: It is unfortunate that the G4 Play has an outdated processor instead of a new one.RAMPro: 2GB is a solid amount of RAM especially for a device that has a starting price of Rs.8999Con: Even though the amount of RAM integrated in the device is substantial, the CPU is what drives the speed and that is slightly outdated.CameraPro: Having 8 megapixels on the back and 5 megapixels on the front is a solid offering.Con: The camera on the Moto G4 Play tends to struggle in low light conditions and the video recordings can be a bit shaky.BatteryPro: The 2,800 mAh battery ensures that you could have as much as a day or a day and a half of phone usage available.Con: The charger that comes with the G4 Play embedded so you can detach the USB cable and connect it to your computer. I would recommend buying a separate Quick Charge 2.0 charger instead of using the one that comes in the box.StoragePro: The ability to expand up to 128GB using a microSD card is convenient. This means you can save a ton of music, photos and video files on the device with the additional storage. Plus Google offers unlimited photo storage through Google Photos, which is seamlessly integrated into the Moto G4 Play.Con: The internal storage options seem to be on the lower end of the scale for smartphones for what you would expect in 2016. Storage tiers offered by other smartphones generally start at 32GB and then go as high as 256GB.Overall ImpressionIf you are looking for a smartphone at a low cost, then the Moto G4 Play pros outweigh the cons. With a starting price of Rs.8999 unlocked and support for all four major U.S. carriers, it seems tough for other manufacturers to beat the Moto G4.There are some minor differences that the lower cost G4 Play has from the G4 and G4 Plus. For example, the G4 Play does not support the karate chop shortcut motion for turning on the flashlight. But if you manage what to expect from a smartphone due to the low cost, then you will likely be satisfied. I actually recommend this device for someone that is on a budget, someone that is getting a smartphone for the first time or someone that is switching from a feature phone for the first time."  [8] "I'm going to compare this to the Moto E3 Power so that everyone can decide whether to give 1,000 bucks moreI will judge the phones on 5 factors:1.Build2.Display3.Performance4.Camera5.BatteryBuild Quality-Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play look quite similar to each other. Both feature a plastic body with a sort of textured finish. But the Moto E3 Power houses a separate speaker grill at the bottom bezels while the Moto G4 Play has a mono grill at the top for the earpiece and speaker. The sound output is better on E3 Power due to the dedicated speaker grill.The back of Moto E3 Power lacks a textured finish while the Moto G4 Play has a texture design on back, making it easy to hold in hand.Display-Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play feature a 5\" inch 720 x 1280 pixels 294 ppi pixel density display. It's fairly bright and offers great contrast thanks to the low black levels. Sunlight legibility is also good.The viewing angles are great as well.Both the phones have Corning Gorilla Glass 3 Protection and Nano Coating which makes them splash proof or accidental water spillings.While the Moto G4 Play has the Moto Display and other Moto Actions, the E3 Power doesn't have them since it doesn't have the Moto App.Performance-Here things take a kind of a ugly turn.The E3 Power runs on a MediaTek 6735P QuadCore CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1GHz and a Mali-T720 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 1.1GB to be free. Switching between apps and multi-tasking is fluid. The phone has noticeable lags on heavy usage. The device performs poorly on heavy gaming, although midrange games like Subway Surfers run well without any issues. No heating issues as well.The G4 Play runs on a Snapdragon 410 Quad Core CPU, which houses four Cortex-A53s clocked at 1.2GHz and a Adreno 306 GPU. You get 2GB of Ram. On the first boot you'll find around 900 MB to be free. Ram management seems poor on G4 Play as compared to E3 Power as the usage seems to be more. But surprisingly the device fares better to E3 Power in terms of multi-tasking and Gaming due to a powerful CPU. Asphalt 8 runs smoothly without any issue. The device heats upto 38.C to 40.C which isn't always an issue.Camera-Both the E3 Power and G4 Play house a 8MP Rear and 5MP Front facing Camera. The performance is above average in daylight and proper lighting conditions. The Camera performs average in night and low light. The flash is really helpful in low light. The device runs Moto's Stock Camera app with a Shutter button. You can use the exposure mode, Panoroma, HDR or Video Modes. While the E3 Power can only record 720p videos, G4 Play can record upto 1080p videos. The Camera focusing on E3 Power is better than that of G4 Play, so is the post image processing but the shutter speed is better in G4 Play.The Selfie Camera will really delight you. You can always use a 3rd Party filter app on the both these devices to take some neat selfies.Battery-While the E3 Power comes with a 3500maH battery, the G4 Play comes with a 2800maH battery. The battery on E3 Power is nothing short to incredible and easily lasts for a day with moderate usage. and last over 1.5 days but with heavy usage lasts only upto 9 to 10 hours.. You can get screen on-time of 8 to 9 hours easily. The rapid charger bundled with the phone takes 2 to 3 hours to fully charge the device from 0%.The G4 Play lasts upto a day with moderate usage but with heavy usage lasts only upto 7 to 8 hours. The G4 Play also comes with the rapid charger and the charging takes around 3 hours.Both the phones feature a removable battery.However the battery life on the E3 Power has reduced after a software updateBugs- The Moto E3 Power has a major bugWhen you plug an OTG cable in and use a pendrive or connect anything via OTG, after unplugging itit will nit charge. You need to restart the phone to make it work. However, this has been fixed with a software updateIt comes with Voice over LTE (VOLTE) out of the box.It does not have the Moto App so you wont get the Moto Actions or Moto Display.Both the Moto E3 Power and G4 Play run of Stock Android version of Android 6.0 Marshmallow with Minor Tweaks by Motorola. Although the E3 Power is a month old, it won't get the Android Nougat 7.0 update which is a huge disappointment for budget users, while the G4 Play will get Android 7.0 Nougat Update.Conclusion-If you are a light user and want better battery life and don't care much about software updates go for the E3 PowerBut if you are a heavy user and you want better gaming and software updates, go for the G4 PlayAfter all, good smartphones have become cheaper and cheap smartphones have got really good.And we no longer judge a phone by how good they are. Instead we judge them by how bad they are or how many flaws do they have.P.S. I had recently received a call from Motorola where we had a long talk regarding the Nougat update for Moto E3 Power. I had asked them to release the update for it. They said they are still testing it and they might release it soon."

[10] "I have been using this device for the last 4 months .-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  PROS------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------> The display resolution is only a HD panel but because of the smaller 5 inch size the pixel density is higher than a 5.5 inch. Color representation,  saturation and brightness are evenly balanced with good viewing angles.->  Its processor is powered by a 1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 chipset which is kind of decent.-> Along with that it comes with a primary memory of 2 GB. Now compared to its counterparts its more than enough as Moto devices are completely bloatware free.-> Next Moto G4 Play pros is that for gaming the graphics is powered by Adreno 306 which runs many of the high end games smoothly.-> Consumers buy Motorola smartphones primarily for their clean software. And yes this one is absolutely clean which is almost stock Android. The version of the Marshmallow 6.0.1 which is currently the latest one.-> While many smartphones are ditching their memory card slot, this smartphone has a got dedicated one. It can be expanded up to 128 GB with the help of a microSD card.->  Another Moto G4 Play pros is the nano coating over the smartphone display provides water repellent feature. (But remember that this is not water resistant).->  The battery capacity is of 2800 mAh which is enough for a 5 inch screen smartphone to last throughout the day even for an avid user.-> For the protection of the display it comes with a Corning Gorilla 3.->  And yes it has a fast battery charging technology, not Quick Charge though but with a 10 watt rapid charger-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  CONS------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ >The first is the quality of both the 8 megapixel primary camera and 5 megapixel secondary camera is not good in low light condition. The LED flash helps a little but not much to remove grains. The reason is because of the smaller f/2.2 focal aperture.->  Next Moto G4 Play cons is that despite being a small 5 inch smartphone it still feels bulky due to the thickness of 9.9 mm. This is too thick in today’s standard.->  At the current price tag there are dozens of smartphones that does comes with a fingerprint sensor, but this one ain’t got one.->  Another Moto G Play 4th Gen cons is that there is no dedicated navigational touch buttons below the screen. The screen is already a small one and the navigation’s are all placed on the screen itself.-> And finally the last Moto G Play (4th Gen) cons is that there is no gyroscope sensor.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Overall Impression---------------------------If you are looking for a smartphone at a low cost, then the Moto G4 Play pros outweigh the cons.  it seems tough for other manufacturers to beat the Moto G4.  There are some minor differences that the lower cost G4 Play has from the G4 and G4 Plus. For example, the G4 Play does not support the karate chop shortcut motion for turning on the flashlight. But if you manage what to expect from a smartphone due to the low cost, then you will likely be satisfied. I actually recommend this device for someone that is on a budget, someone that is getting a smartphone for the first time or someone that is switching from a feature phone for the first time."

 [7] "I bought this phone as my brother's birthday gift.Here are some pros and cons of this phone.PROS:--1. The display resolution is only a HD panel but because of the smaller 5 inch size the pixel density is higher than a 5.5 inch. Color representation, saturation and brightness are evenly balanced with good viewing angles.2. Its processor is powered by a 1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 chipset which is kind of decent.3. Along with that it comes with a primary memory of 2 GB. Now compared to its counterparts its more than enough as Moto devices are completely bloatware free.4. Next Moto G4 Play pros is that for gaming the graphics is powered by Adreno 306 which runs many of the high end games smoothly.5. Consumers buy Motorola smartphones primarily for their clean software. And yes this one is absolutely clean which is almost stock Android. The version of the Marshmallow 6.0.1 which is currently the latest one.6. While many smartphones are ditching their memory card slot, this smartphone has a got dedicated one. It can be expanded up to 128 GB with the help of a microSD card.7. Another Moto G4 Play pros is the nano coating over the smartphone display provides water repellent feature. (But remember that this is not water resistant).8. The battery capacity is of 2800 mAh which is enough for a 5 inch screen smartphone to last throughout the day even for an avid user.9. For the protection of the display it comes with a Corning Gorilla 3.10. And yes it has a fast battery charging technology, not Quick Charge though but with a 10 watt rapid charger.CONS:--1. The first is the quality of both the 8 megapixel primary camera and 5 megapixel secondary camera is not good in low light condition. The LED flash helps a little but not much to remove grains. The reason is because of the smaller f/2.2 focal aperture.2. Next Moto G4 Play cons is that despite being a small 5 inch smartphone it still feels bulky due to the thickness of 9.9 mm. This is too thick in today’s standard.3. At the current price tag there are dozens of smartphones that does comes with a fingerprint sensor, but this one ain’t got one.4. Another Moto G Play 4th Gen cons is that there is no dedicated navigational touch buttons below the screen. The screen is already a small one and the navigation’s are all placed on the screen itself.5. And finally the last Moto G Play (4th Gen) cons is that there is no gyroscope sensor.Conclusion :-- Good but nothing to impress. But if you are looking for some other alternative The Moto G4 Play is not the most exciting smartphone around. Instead, it delivers reasonably decent performance for its price, along with standard battery life and good ergonomics. However, everything considered, the Xiaomi Redmi 3s Prime and Lenovo Vibe K5 are better buys. The G4 Play is advisable for those who do not heavily task their phones, and hold brand value as priority."
 [8] "I can hardly call for more than a couple of minutes and then the call quality starts to deteriorate. After some seconds I cannot hear anything, although I am audible to the other party. Forget all smart features, calling is the most basic function and if moto cannot even manage to do a decent job there, what else? Horrible experience, shall avoid the brand at any cost in future."  [2] "#designPro: The Moto G4 is lightweight and packed with solid hardware.Con: Missing features like NFC are kind of a bummer.#DisplayPro: By making the display smaller in the G4 Play, it makes the device easier to grip.Con: Unfortunately, the display has a lower resolution — which makes it less sharp than the other G4 devices.#User InterfacePro: The lack of clutter in the operating system makes the G4 Play much more intuitive than other Android devices.Con: The lack of bells and whistles makes it less appealing to consumers that want higher end smartphones. For example, you won’t be able to record in 4K using the G4 Play nor does it have a fingerprint sensor.#ProcessorPro: The Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor is sufficient for handling productive tasks using the G4 Play.Con: It is unfortunate that the G4 Play has an outdated processor instead of a new one.#RAMPro: 2GB is a solid amount of RAM especially for a device that has a starting price of $99.Con: Even though the amount of RAM integrated in the device is substantial, the CPU is what drives the speed and that is slightly outdated.#CameraPro: Having 8 megapixels on the back and 5 megapixels on the front with a starting price of $99 is a solid offering.Con: The camera on the Moto G4 Play tends to struggle in low light conditions and the video recordings can be a bit shaky.#BatteryPro: The 2,800 mAh battery ensures that you could have as much as a day or a day and a half of phone usage available.Con: The charger that comes with the G4 Play embedded so you can detach the USB cable and connect it to your computer. I would recommend buying a separate Quick Charge 2.0 charger instead of using the one that comes in the box.#StoragePro: The ability to expand up to 128GB using a microSD card is convenient. This means you can save a ton of music, photos and video files on the device with the additional storage. Plus Google offers unlimited photo storage through Google Photos, which is seamlessly integrated into the Moto G4 Play.Con: The internal storage options seem to be on the lower end of the scale for smartphones for what you would expect in 2016. Storage tiers offered by other smartphones generally start at 32GB and then go as high as 256GB.Overall ImpressionIf you are looking for a smartphone at a low cost, then the Moto G4 Play pros outweigh the cons. With a starting price of $99.99 unlocked and support for all four major U.S. carriers, it seems tough for other manufacturers to beat the Moto G4.There are some minor differences that the lower cost G4 Play has from the G4 and G4 Plus. For example, the G4 Play does not support the karate chop shortcut motion for turning on the flashlight. But if you manage what to expect from a smartphone due to the low cost, then you will likely be satisfied. I actually recommend this device for someone that is on a budget, someone that is getting a smartphone for the first time or someone that is switching from a feature phone for the first time."

with my purchase.Conclusion----------------This is for those people who need good battery life ,decent performance for basic day to day tasks ,good call quality and ofcourse a phone with good build quality and after sales support.The camera is enough for basic picture snapping.Overall I am really satisfied with my purchase.This phone really exceeded my expectations.Thanks I hope you like my  [5] "I bought this on Amazon for 8999/- This is a mid range phone 4G from Motorola (now Lenovo Owned) with a decent range of specifications (Snapdragon 410 and Quad Core - 1.2 Ghz) and good build quality for a budget phone. I bought this in white and it looks quite good though obviously tends to show dirt and stains faster. The back panel has a nice grippy textured feel to it which feels great to hold.I've been using this for about a week now and its been a mixed bag of reactions towards the Moto G Play. While build quality and hardware remains good for the price, the specifications and camera do leave you wanting a bit more at times. Compares equally with other phones in the same range.Pros:1) The Build quality is very good. Motorola have not compromised on hardware even at this price and the buttons feel robust and firm. The steel band around the outer chassis feels well put together. The power button which is oddly placed above the volume rocker has a nice lined grip to it.2) Audio quality is good, not great. The ringer is adequate though in a noisy environment you could miss hearing it. The speaker and mic are good enough, clarity is excellent and the mic does not pick up in-necessary noise from the surroundings. It also has a tiny noise cancelling mic (or ambient noise sensor) at the rear near the camera which helps I guess.3) Camera is average. With a 8MP rear facing and 5 MP front selfie camera which is the norm for most budget phones, the pictures are crisp clear and more than enough for daytime or brightly lit subjects. Sadly night shots which require the flash are grainy, have a lot of noise and are just about average with a lot of details not showing through.4) Software & Specs. The phone comes with Android Marshmallow out of the box. v6.0.1. Being a Motorola it is not loaded with bloatware of any kind (which is just awesome) and runs the stock OS. So, the memory remains nice & clean, nothing to delete and the phone runs great.5) The phone comes with the standard range of accessories in the Box, a quick charger 10W (0-60% in 25 mins) which doubles as the data cable, a set of instruction manuals with warranty conditions. No headphones supplied.6) Screen. With a 5\" IPS LCD the display is bright and clear though not very crisp like some of the new HD displays. It is fairly readable in bright sunlight and has a good touch response.7) Battery Life. With a removable 2800 mAh battery, the phone easily lasts a day or more with moderate to heavy usage at times. Charges quickly enough with the supplied charger and battery drain is fairly slow even during intensive gaming and other apps usage.The best part is that the phone has a water repellant Nano Coating to it so even a little bit of water or splashes wont damage it. As well as Corning Gorilla Glass 3. *As claimed by Motorola.Cons: Nothing much to be negative about, the phone performs flawlessly as expected. So far no hanging, normal levels of heating with some random gaming, internet, You Tube and WhatsApp on all the time.A good buy at this price, nothing special compared to other phones in the same price bracket. Buy if for solid and long lasting build quality and a clutter free Android OS. Not to mention now that Lenovo has bought over Motorola, there are plenty of service centers all over."

[10] "Reasons to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Pros):1. The display resolution is only a HD panel but because of the smaller 5 inch size the pixel density is higher than a 5.5 inch. Color representation, saturation and brightness are evenly balanced with good viewing angles.2. Its processor is powered by a 1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 chipset which is kind of decent.3. Along with that it comes with a primary memory of 2 GB. Now compared to its counterparts its more than enough as Moto devices are completely bloatware free.4. Next Moto G4 Play pros is that for gaming the graphics is powered by Adreno 306 which runs many of the high end games smoothly.5. Consumers buy Motorola smartphones primarily for their clean software. And yes this one is absolutely clean which is almost stock Android. The version of the Marshmallow 6.0.1 which is currently the latest one.6. While many smartphones are ditching their memory card slot, this smartphone has a got dedicated one. It can be expanded up to 128 GB with the help of a microSD card.7. Another Moto G4 Play pros is the nano coating over the smartphone display provides water repellent feature. (But remember that this is not water resistant).8. The battery capacity is of 2800 mAh which is enough for a 5 inch screen smartphone to last throughout the day even for an avid user.9. For the protection of the display it comes with a Corning Gorilla 3.10. And yes it has a fast battery charging technology, not Quick Charge though but with a 10 watt rapid charger.Reasons Not to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Cons):1. The first is the quality of both the 8 megapixel primary camera and 5 megapixel secondary camera is not good in low light condition. The LED Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Black)flash helps a little but not much to remove grains. The reason is because of the smaller f/2.2 focal aperture.2. Next Moto G4 Play cons is that despite being a small 5 inch smartphone it still feels bulky due to the thickness of 9.9 mm. This is too thick in today’s standard.3. At the current price tag there are dozens of smartphones that does comes with a fingerprint sensor, but this one ain’t got one.4. Another Moto G Play 4th Gen cons is that there is no dedicated navigational touch buttons below the screen. The screen is already a small one and the navigation’s are all placed on the screen itself.5. And finally the last Moto G Play (4th Gen) cons is that there is no gyroscope sensor.My Verdict: Good but nothing to impress. But in case if you are looking for a better alternative smartphone that removes some of the cons of this one then follow the link below."

 [6] "--------------------------------------------------------Moto G Play (4th Gen) Specifications:--------------------------------------------------------a) Display: 5.0” 720p HD (1280×720), 294 ppib) Dimensions: Height: 144.4 mm / Width: 72 mm / Depth: 8.95 mm to 9.9 mmc) Weight: 137gd) Operating System: ndroid(TM) 6.0.1, Marshmallowe) System Architecture/Processor: Up to 1.2 GHz, Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ 410 quad-core processor with 450 MHz Adreno 306 GPUf) RAM: 2GB3g) ROM: 16 GB internal1, up to 128 GB microSD Card supporth) Battery: 2800 mAh, 10W quick charger gives 5 hours of power in only 15 mins of chargei) Rear Camera: 8 MP, f/2.2 aperture, LED flash, Tap (anywhere) to capture, 4X digital zoom, Burst mode, Auto HDR, Panorama, Drag to focus & exposure, 1080p HD video (30 fps)j) Front Camera: 5 MP, f/2.2 aperture, Display flash, Beautification mode, Best shot, ideo Capture 1080p, 30fps)k) SIM Card: Micro-SIM, nano-SIM with an adaptorl) Connectivity: Micro USB, 3.5mm headset jack, Bluetooth version 4.1 LE, Wi-Fi: 802.11 b/g/n (2.4 GHz)m) Networks: 4G LTE (VoLTE), UMTS / HSPA+, GSM / EDGEn) Water Protection: Water repellent nano-coatingo) Sensors: Accelerometer, Proximity, Ambient Lightp) Base Color: Black or whiteq) Moto G Play Price in India: INR 8999• Key Specifications:Mot G Play  4th Gen has 5″ HD display. It  is powered by Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ 410 processor with quad-core CPU and has 4G VoLTE capabilities. G Play (4th Gen) is equipped with upto 2GB RAM and 16 GB internal storage expandable to 128 GB microSD Card support. It has 2800mAh battery and comes with a 10W Rapid Charger that can charge the Moto G Play for upto  5 hours in just 15 minutes.Moto G Play 4th Gen will be available in Black and White colour options.• Camera:The rear camera is 8 MP camera and the front camera is 5MP. The rear camera has ƒ/2.2 aperture and a a camera sensor that uses larger-than-average pixels. It  shoots photos and videos at 30fps in 1080p.  The 5MP front facing camera has beautification mode and Best Shot mode to help the user take better selfies.• Durability:For durability, the Moto G Play has a water-repellent nano-coating that can protect it from minor spills and splashes of water.• Battery:With a 2800 mAh battery, you can go from morning to night without worrying about battery life.Moto G Play, 4th Gen comes with the 10W rapid charger, which gives you 5 hours of battery life in just 15 minutes of charging.• 4G Volte Speed:The new Moto G Play, 4th Gen runs at 4G speed and supports VOLTE, so you can get to the good stuff faster. Stream videos and music smoothly without any annoying stops and starts. And browse the web without waiting for pages to load.-------------------------------------------------------------------Reasons to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Pros):-------------------------------------------------------------------1. The display resolution is only a HD panel but because of the smaller 5 inch size the pixel density is higher than a 5.5 inch. Color representation, saturation and brightness are evenly balanced with good viewing angles.2. Its processor is powered by a 1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 chipset which is kind of decent.3. Along with that it comes with a primary memory of 2 GB. Now compared to its counterparts its more than enough as Moto devices are completely bloatware free.4. Next Moto G4 Play pros is that for gaming the graphics is powered by Adreno 306 which runs many of the high end games smoothly.5. Consumers buy Motorola smartphones primarily for their clean software. And yes this one is absolutely clean which is almost stock Android. The version of the Marshmallow 6.0.1 which is currently the latest one.6. While many smartphones are ditching their memory card slot, this smartphone has a got dedicated one. It can be expanded up to 128 GB with the help of a microSD card.7. Another Moto G4 Play pros is the nano coating over the smartphone display provides water repellent feature. (But remember that this is not water resistant).8. The battery capacity is of 2800 mAh which is enough for a 5 inch screen smartphone to last throughout the day even for an avid user.9. For the protection of the display it comes with a Corning Gorilla 3.10. And yes it has a fast battery charging technology, not Quick Charge though but with a 10 watt rapid charger.--------------------------------------------------------------------------Reasons Not to Buy Moto G Play, 4th Gen (Cons):--------------------------------------------------------------------------1. The first is the quality of both the 8 megapixel primary camera and 5 megapixel secondary camera is not good in low light condition. The LED flash helps a little but not much to remove grains. The reason is because of the smaller f/2.2 focal aperture.2. Next Moto G4 Play cons is that despite being a small 5 inch smartphone it still feels bulky due to the thickness of 9.9 mm. This is too thick in today’s standard.3. At the current price tag there are dozens of smartphones that does comes with a fingerprint sensor, but this one ain’t got one.4. Another Moto G Play 4th Gen cons is that there is no dedicated navigational touch buttons below the screen. The screen is already a small one and the navigation’s are all placed on the screen itself.5. And finally the last Moto G Play (4th Gen) cons is that there is no gyroscope sensor."
